title: U.S. Army Ground Vehicle Systms Center (GVSC)
description:
Software Acquisition Management Analyst

 

Privacy Act Statement for Job Announcement

The information requested is being collected to evaluate your qualifications and suitability for potential employment with the U.S. Army Ground Vehicles Systems Center (GVSC) pursuant to the hiring authorities specified in 5 U.S.C. 3301, 3304, 3320, 3361, 3393, 3394, and other associated statutes within Title 5, United States Code.

 

The information you provide may be used and disclosed to third parties as generally allowed by the Privacy Act of 1974, 5 U.S.C. 552a, as necessary to obtain additional information related to your qualifications and suitability for potential employment. It may also be disclosed pursuant to any of the routine uses identified in the OPM/GOVT-5 System of Records Notice, "Recruiting, Examining, and Placement Records."

 

Furnishing this information is voluntary; however, failure to provide the information requested may delay or prevent us from further considering you for potential employment with the U.S. Army Ground Vehicles Systems Center (GVSC).

Job Title:

Senior Software Engineer or Software Engineer III with GVSC’s Software Engineering Center, Department of Army, Warren, MI.

 

About GVSC:

The U.S. Army Ground Vehicles Systems Center (GVSC) is a major element of Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) and partner in the Tank Automotive and Armaments Command (TACOM) Life Cycle Management Command (LCMC). As a full life-cycle engineering support provider-of-first-choice for all Department Of Defense (DoD) ground combat and tactical vehicles, weapons and support systems, GVSC develops and integrates the right technology solutions to improve Current Force effectiveness and provide superior capabilities for the Future Force.  GVSC’s Software Engineering Center (SEC) provides software engineering and software life cycle management services to ground systems acquisition and technology development programs. GVSC’s Software Engineering Center is responsible for developing, acquiring, integrating, assessing, supporting and maintaining software products. For more information visit www.army.mil/gvsc.

 

Job Overview (Summary):

The Software Acquisition Management Analyst will have a hands-on role with the acquisition support of software for the Army’s current and future ground combat and tactical vehicles, weapons and support systems; and will require involvement in all stages of the development cycle.

Job Description:

  • Develop annual department budget plan utilizing data from the organization’s project listing, outstanding Statements of Work (SOW), spend plans, and cost estimates.
  • Manage the execution of department budgets and project spend plans.
  • Assist engineers in the development of SOW’s, work break down structures, resource loaded scheduling, and required contract mechanisms.
  • Utilize and maintain organizationally-developed specific reporting tools to provide and maintain project budgets.
  • Develop, review, evaluate and make recommendations concerning acquisition documents, priorities, schedules, cost estimates, budgets, milestones and other program matters bearing on project/program assignments.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Qualification:

  • Must have at least a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or Engineering.
  • Preferred Master of Business Administration (MBA) with course work related to managerial accounting and managerial finance.
  • Prior demonstrated experience developing annual budgets.
  • Prior demonstrated experience developing cost estimates at the component or system level.
  • Must have experience working in a cross-functional team including engineers.
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain a secret security clearance.
  • Must be a US Citizen.

 

Desired Competencies:

  • Familiarity with cost estimating techniques for software development and sustainment.
  • Familiarity using Earned Value Management (EVM) or similar metrics for measuring project performance.
  • Familiarity with SQL database management.
  • Familiarity with GFEBS or SAP based enterprise resource planning system.
  • Prior demonstrated experience developing annual department or project budgets.
  • Familiarity with industry-standard process methodologies (e.g., Six Sigma, LEAN, CMMI, etc.)

 

Applicants:

Please email your resume to:  usarmy.detroit.rdecom.mbx.tardec-resumes@mail.milusarmy.detroit.ccdc-gvsc.mbx.sec-sw-acquisition@mail.mil

title: CVS Health
description:
Job Description
In the Office of the CTO, we design world-class, innovative, integrated, scalable and balanced system solutions aligned with Business and IT strategies. With critical thinking, deep business knowledge, situational awareness and multi-disciplinary experience, we deliver the transformational insight, trusted advice and technical leadership needed to make optimal use of technology and information assets.

In accordance with Office of the CTO policies and processes, this person will help deliver architectural solutions.

In this role, you will partner with other architects to:
- record, document and maintain O-CTO documents and processes
- With guidance develop, specify and communicate Office of the CTO solution architectures, technology plans, products and services.
Position requires working knowledge of business processes, architecture design principles and practices.

RESPONSIBILITIES
- Studies & documents/participates with senior architects in developing frameworks, standards and reference material for architecture and associated products.
- Contributes to the development and maintenance of common services, repositories, and utility components for the enterprise.
- Provides lab and vendor support.
- Performs related duties as assigned or requested with general supervision.
- Manages the architecture governance activities associated with ensuring solution compliance.
- Performs research and development activities for the Office of the CTO.
- With guidance creates work product deliverables in accordance with Office of the CTO products and services.
- With Guidance designs, supports and deploys mechanisms to enhance, refine, and deliver the architecture vision.



PROFESSIONAL SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE
- Understands and uses documentation tools
- Contributes to and maintains a curated representation of CVS Health’s software architecture.
- Demonstrates basic knowledge and aptitude in both business & technical discussions.
- Ability to multi-task and switch context between architecture initiatives.
- Effective interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to communicate and influence appropriately through written, verbal and visual presentations.
- Willing collaborator and consensus-builder, who can form outcome-based partnerships across teams and organizations.
- Demonstrated EQ, listening, fast learning, documentation and problem-solving skills a must.
- Demonstrates understanding of design or software engineering at the application level.
- Understands & applies conceptual architecture vision and principles.
- Understands business language & engages actively in technical discussions.
- Demonstrated understanding of industry and technology trends.
- When applicable - Anticipates and proactively responds to future customer, industry and information technology needs.
- Demonstrates basic knowledge and aptitude in both business & technical discussions.
- Ability to multi-task and switch context between architecture initiatives.
- Effective interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to communicate and influence appropriately through written, verbal and visual presentations.
- Ability to think creatively and drive innovation.

Required Qualifications
3+ years experience working in a professional organization, including recent and related experience in information systems development or implementation

Preferred Qualifications
1+ years recent and related experience in information systems development or implementation.
- Experience with object-oriented modeling principles (inheritance, polymorphism) and methods (use cases, sequence diagrams, etc.) is a plus
- Experience with architectural abstractions and design patterns is a plus

Education
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
Will accept verifiable HS Diploma / GED with one year of relevant work experience for every year of college not attained in addition to required years of experience.

Business Overview
It’s a new day in health care.

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.

At CVS Health, we work every day to help people on their path to better health. Never has it been more important for us to deliver on our purpose to our valued customers, patients, members, and employees. With a presence in communities across the country, CVS Health colleagues are and will continue to be a critical piece of the country’s health care solution. The health and safety of our employees, patients, customers, and members is our top priority as we face the impact of COVID-19 together. If you would like to learn about the actions we are taking as a company as we learn more about COVID-19 and its spread, we encourage you to visit our COVID-19 resource center at https://cvshealth.com/covid-19
We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.

CVS Health is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Gender/Ethnicity/Disability/Protected Veteran – we highly value and are committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities. We comply with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is the Law Poster: EEO IS THE LAW and EEO IS THE LAW SUPPLEMENT. Please note that we only accept applications for employment via this site.

We provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need to request an accommodation, a qualified interpreter, written information in other formats, translation or other services, please contact our Advice and Counsel Reasonable Accommodations team by emailing Advice and Counsel Reasonable Accommodations team or calling 877-805-9511.

If technical issues are preventing you from applying to a position, contact Kenexa Helpdesk at 1-855-338-5609 or cvshealthsupport@us.ibm.com. For technical issues with the Virtual Job Tryout, contact the Modern Hire Help Desk at 1-877-451-1695 or cvs_support@modernhire.com.

title: Port Authority of Allegheny County
description:
Port Authority is seeking a Software Support Analyst to support day-to-day software application and operational management for software.  Primary support will be for the Work Order and Asset Management System(s), with cross-support for other related applications also included.  Works with Authority and vendor personnel to identify any technology related issues with the software application and then follows through until conclusion.  Provides training support, and assistance in the design of user documentation.   

 

Essential Functions:  

  • Serve as technical analyst of software: Analyze application error and message logs, and work to resolve issues. Manage database storage and application software for periodic version updates and upgrades.
  • Serve as customer support for software usage: Guide users with functional support and assist with navigating software. Resolve help desk tickets related to application software.  Provide system end-user instruction for report generation and system functionality and also assist in the design of user documentation. 
  • Support data import/export/management.
  • Support reporting: Provide support with Crystal Report and Ad-Hoc Query Development.

 

Job requirements include: 

  • Two year technical school/Associate Degree in Computer Science, Information Science or technology related field from an accredited school with five (5) years relevant experience in web-based software application using SQL or
  • BS Degree in Computer Science, Information Science or a technology related field from an accredited school or related field with three (3) years relevant experience in web-based software applications using SQL.
  • Related experience may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to quickly understand, retain and apply large amounts of new information.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
  • Great organizational skills.
  • Experience in monitoring and adhering to procedures and policies.
  • Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to present information in a clear and concise manner.
  • Excellent customer service and problem resolution skills.
  • Professional and effective communication skills.
  • Exemplary attention to detail.
  • Ability to be flexible and adapt to change.
  • Valid PA driver’s license.

 

 Preferred attributes:

  • Prior implementation project experience.
  • Good understanding of a web based EAM or ERP application.
  • Experience with large, complex deployments of an EAM or ERP application.
  • Knowledgeable in Crystal Reports.

 

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package.  Interested candidates should forward a cover letter (with salary requirements) and resume.

EOE

title: SEACOR Holdings Inc
description:
Seabulk provides safe and efficient marine logistics and infrastructure solutions, including bulk transportation, harbor and terminal services and vessel management. With the best personnel, innovative and efficient equipment, we create tailored solutions that meet our customers rigorous demands.

Seabulk operates under the ‘Goal Zero’ safety banner with committed teams performing and solving complex marine logistical and infrastructure solutions to deliver on demand.

We are currently seeking qualified candidates to join our team for the following position:



Job Requirements:

Position Title: Financial Reporting Analyst
 
Reports To: Assistant Controller

Schedule: Monday through Friday and additional as required/requested

Location: Fort Lauderdale, FL 


Qualifications and Skills:

Experience: Minimum 5 years private or 3 years public accounting; mix of private and public is preferred
                            
Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance is required; Master’s Degree in Accounting or Finance and/or CPA license are preferred   

Software: Oracle, Hyperion Financial Management, Workday and Adaptive knowledge is a plus

Traits: Team player, leadership skills, effective verbal and written communication, deadlines driven, ability to multitask and prioritize

Languages: English  

 
Duties and Responsibilities:     

  • Participate in monthly reporting process to include preparation of financial reports for internal use at the company by collecting, analyzing, formatting, and presenting information;
  • Establish and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external customers to secure required information to link operating activities with financial outcomes.
  • Support the accounting month-end close process, including preparation and review of journal entries, account reconciliations, and variance analysis;
  • Liaise with Risk Management, Insurance Broker and Operations to manage and report on open insurance claims;
  • Liaise with internal and external auditors, including SOX compliance, preparation of audit schedules and timely management of audit requests;
  • Prepare financial statements for standalone/ statutory audits; 
  • Assist with the preparation of a quarterly package for the Compliance Committee meeting;
  • Prepare quarterly debt compliance certificate;
  • Participate in the annual budgeting and forecasting process, develop and maintain budget models, work with Operations and other accountants to report on actual vs. budget/ forecast variances;
  • Assist with due diligence for new business acquisitions (opening balance sheet, process narratives, data conversion/upload, etc.);
  • Serve as a team leader for Workday ERP implementation project;
  • Perform ad hoc financial and operational reporting and analysis as needed.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability

title: MPIRE Technology Group, Inc.
description:
MPIRE Technology Group, Inc. is seeking a Counterintelligence Policy Analyst for our client in Arlington, VA. The candidate will have experience in providing support and guidance on development, strategic planning, mission management, and functional integration to DoD stakeholders.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Writing/updating policies, providing oversight, analyzing, interpreting, and adjusting written documents independently and within a team environment.
  • Provide formal reporting and formulate internal staff action sheets, inspection reports and generate deficiency reports ensures corrections are incorporated in policy rewrites.
  • Provides expert guidance to Counterintelligence and Law Enforcement (CI&LE) Directorate seniors and staff on DoD counterintelligence (CI) policy development, strategic planning, mission management, functional integration, and internal Directorate operations.
  • Develops, revises, and staffs CI policy issuances for the informal, formal and signature processes.
  • Ensures comments are properly adjudicated and promulgated within the provision of the Office of the Director guidelines and timeliness standards for DoD Policy directives and instructions.
  • Works with senior CI&LE Directorate personnel to perform CI policy oversight inspections for all DoD components with an organic CI capability and prepares written reports on the results of these inspections.
  • Identifies CI best practices to improve overall efficiency and effectiveness of the DoD CI enterprise, and monitors components efforts to address identified deficiencies to become policy compliant.
  • Researches and drafts responses to questions related to DoD CI issues for senior DoD officials and other DoD stakeholders.
  • Prepares and coordinates staff actions, information papers and official memorandums for distribution within DoD and the Intelligence Community.

Requirements:

  • 7+ years of experience with one of the following sections in DoD Counterintelligence: Operations, Collections, Analysis, and/or Functional Services.
  • Experience with reviewing and updating CI related policies.
  • Knowledge of counterintelligence operation platform and activities related to operations and policy.
  • Knowledge DoD CI policies and instructions.
  • Ability to think critically and interpret provided information to develop policy re-writes.
  • Formal Counterintelligence Training and familiarity with DoD Directive 5240.
  • Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat.
  • Active Top Secret.

Nice to have:

  • Active SCI

Experience: Senior Level (7+ years)

Education: BA/BS in related field

About Us:

MPIRE Technology Group Inc. (MTG) is Small Business that was founded in Virginia. The company offers information technology services consulting and systems integration. Our core offerings include: Software Development, IT/Engineering Support and Cyber Security. MPIRE Technology Group’s technical staff has extensive experience managing and executing the full life cycle of IT infrastructure and development projects. Our teams work alongside their clients helping them to achieve their specific objectives. Our clients continue to use our services because of our high quality of work and our company values.

Our Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Retirement plan
  • Paid time off
  • Professional development assistance

MPIRE Technology Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We are not currently working with 3rd parties.

We are not currently providing sponsorship.

title: Wood Programs Inc. (WPI)
description:
Company Overview

Wood Programs Inc. (WPI) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Wood (Amec Foster Wheeler is now part of Wood), a multinational, engineering and construction and project management company. Wood Programs was established to pursue engineering and construction opportunities with the US Federal government with classified requirements. Our parent Company provides performance-driven solutions throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to decommissioning across a broad range of industrial markets, including the upstream, midstream and downstream oil & gas, power & process, environment and infrastructure, clean energy, mining, nuclear, and general industrial sectors. With a work force of over 60,000 talented professionals in offices in over 60 countries worldwide, Wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. 

Open Position: Project Accounting Analyst 

Role Overview

Wood Programs, Inc. is currently seeking an experienced Project Accountant in Raleigh, NC with demonstrated experience in US Federal Government engineering, construction and operations & maintenance contracting. 

This position requires an experienced hands-on Project Accountant with a strong desire and motivation to build on and support the financial foundation for a growing company. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Work closely with the Finance Director and Project Accounting Manager to oversee project financial performance and support overall accounting and financial functions
  • Support Project Managers in development of their WBS, Estimates at Completion, cost and revenue tracking and project financial performance
  • Maintain routine communication with project managers and Org Managers regarding project accounting functions, including monthly and annual accounting schedules and deadlines
  • Perform monthly and year end accounting close processes for projects with attention to detail, accuracy and deadlines
  • Review monthly project financial results and analyze variances to forecasts and budgets and take appropriate action as needed
  • Perform quality control of system financial reports, create offline ad hoc management reports as required, and assist in the preparation of monthly analysis and commentary of business results
  • Analyze contract requirements and prepare monthly billings in accordance with contract terms and conditions
  • Manage subcontractor cost tracking and payment release
  • Timely and accurate preparation of selected monthly balance sheet account reconciliations
  • Assist in the annual budgeting and periodic forecasting processes
  • Support the Company President and Functional Leads in financial and administrative inquiries and tasks
  • Actively liaise with the parent company Accounting, Finance, and Contracts department
  • Support inquiries and audits involving contract close-outs, DCAA/DCMA inquiries, internal audits, etc.      
  • Respond to financial and general task order inquiries by gathering, analyzing, summarizing, and interpreting data
  • Support the Company purchase order process
  • Limited travel may be required for training and project related support

Skills / Qualifications

Role Requirements: 

  • US citizenship required
  • Strong knowledge and experience in project accounting functional areas including project performance measurement and reporting, revenue recognition, billing and collection, subcontractor invoice management
  • Understanding of accounting/financial procedures – knowledge of GAAP, internal controls, ability to ensure that company minimizes audit risk
  • Working knowledge of general ledger functions including account reconciliation, journal entry preparation and financial analysis
  • Understanding of U.S. Federal Government Compliance, including FAR and CAS
  • Strong computer skills including MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Ability to learn other company and/or government software used to manage specific programs
  • Good written and spoken communication skills  

Education and Experience: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance
  • CPA preferred but not required
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience performing project accounting functions
  • Solid experience in US Federal Government engineering, construction and operations & maintenance contracting
  • Strong organization and automation skills, including experience with process review and workflow optimization
  • Experience with a fully integrated project management accounting system
  • Demonstrated experience to serve as knowledgeable office administration resource

If you believe you have the necessary knowledge, experience and enthusiasm to succeed in this position, then we would like to hear from you.

We offer competitive salaries along with a complete benefits package including: medical, vision, & dental coverage, 401K Matching, Educational Reimbursement, and a variety of Training and Development Programs to help you develop the skills you need to succeed in your chosen career path.

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and/or protected veteran status in accordance with governing laws.

By submitting your resume, you consent to Wood plc sharing this information within its divisions in order to identify other employment opportunities for which you may be suitable.

title: HAVI Global Solutions

title: Integrity Consulting
description:
INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY DUTIES: 

 

Onsite support for performing network troubleshooting to isolate and diagnose common network problems. Upgrade network hardware and software components as required. Install, upgrade, and configure network printing, directory structures, rights, security, and software on file servers. Provides users with network technical support and respond to user's needs and questions related to their access of resources on the network. Establishes network users, user environment, directories, and security for network being installed.

 

Knowledge of the following devices and systems:

  • VoIP Phone Systems
  • Power Over Ethernet (PoE) Switches
  • Firewall and VPN Configurations
  • EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)
  • RF Technologies
  • Wireless Technologies and Standards
  • Tablet Devices (Apple and Android)
  • Video Surveillance Systems
  • Access Control Systems
  • Audio Visual Systems
  • Software Specific to Departments (Accounting, Graphic Arts. RoadNet) .
  • Responsible for ensuring that information systems are functioning up to standards. This is a broad area encompassing the following:
  • Maintain knowledge of developments in the area of software and hardware and
  • incorporate these developments into future systems of the company.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving system problems to users, including on-call hours.
  • Maintaining user files and related security on the various information systems.
  • Perform changes in computer and communication system hardware and software so that expenses and downtime are minimized while ensuring reliable and timely services.
  • Responsible for the development of accounting, sales and warehouse reports under the VIP System. This will require developing a significant level of expertise with the VIP Report Writers.
  • Plan and devise education programs to ensure users can adequately use the system.
  • Responsible for disaster recovery of the various information systems. This entails ensuring daily back-ups of the computer systems and monthly backups of the communication systems.
  • This area would also include maintenance and annual testing of a disaster recovery plan.
  • Prepare an annual information systems budget and establish controls to stay within the specified limits of that budget. From a control perspective, this includes:
  • Review and maintain a file of all maintenance agreements.
  • Review and approve all maintenance and consulting fee billings.
  • Perform other duties as assigned or required.
  • Obey all Federal, State and local laws.

title: United Global Technologies
description:
Position Summary:

Maintain a portfolio of one or more hardware and/or software technologies, products, and/or processes including standards of use, life cycles, and/or product evaluation and integration.  Develop and maintain an in-depth pool of technical advice and expertise to provide information and guidance of the infrastructure assigned.

Specifically, this Analyst’s technology portfolio focuses on web and application servers, including Microsoft IIS, Red Hat JBoss Web Server, Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform (EAP), and IBM WebSphere Application Server.

Required Education:

  • Bachelor's degree in in Computer Science, Information Technology or other job related degree, OR
  • 4 ADDED years of job related work experience, OR
  • 2 ADDED years of job related experience plus an associate’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other job related degree

Required Work Experience:

  • 4 years of specific knowledge of the technology(s), product(s), and/or processes to be supported.

o            Technologies requiring this specific knowledge include Microsoft IIS (multiple versions), and its deep integration with Microsoft Windows Server (multiple versions).

  • 1 year directly supporting the technology(s), product(s), and/or processes. (may be concurrent)

o            Technologies requiring this direct support include Red Hat JBoss Web Server and Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform (EAP).

  • 1 year experience development using PowerShell
  • 1 year experience performing web development
  • 1 year experience managing security configurations for your technology, including ARS and NIST controls, and guidance by appropriate STIGs

Required Skills and Abilities:

  • Knowledge of a variety of information technology products and solutions.
  • Excellent research, customer service, verbal and written communication, and presentation skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Good judgment.
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively with all levels of the IT organization.
  • Ability to identify complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and to implement solutions.
  • Demonstrated analytical and decision-making skills.
  • Deep understanding of Windows permissions, including ACL, GPO, and ADUC.
  • Experience using Excel.
  • Excellent independent and strategic thinker.
  • Excellent synergizer within the organization.

Preferred Work Experience:

  • Experience with software distribution practices at an enterprise level
  • Experience with lifecycle of services at an enterprise level
  • 1 year directly supporting the following:

o            IBM WebSphere Application Server

o            Microsoft Message Analyzer

o            Microsoft Message Queue

  • Experience deploying technologies utilizing IBM BigFix
  • Experience in non-Windows operating systems, such as various flavors of UNIX or Linux

May schedule regular meetings, conference calls, or on-site visits with vendors and/or stake holders to keep abreast of current technology(s), products, and/or processes. May review with vendor and/or stake holders, known upcoming activities associated with their specific technology(s), product(s), and/or processes.  Research and stay abreast of all information that may impact the lifecycle of any supported technology, product, and/or process.

title: Technology Recruiting Solutions Inc
description:
JDE World Systems Analyst

Morrow, GA

Extremely stable Georgia based company has an immediate need for a JDE World Systems Analyst for a permanent onsite position.

Requirements include:

  • 10 years experience in programming, systems and business analysis and managing large projects. 
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • 5 years of successful experience in implementing, training, or maintaining JD EdwardsWorld ERP System (not Enterprise system.)
  • Experience with operating systems such as Windows Server and AS/400 DB2 servers is desirable, and experience working with program version control and change management processes is desirable.

 

Responsibilities include:

Implementation and operational management of Magic software system (middleware) for integration between JDE World system and other external systems such as Salesforce, FTP and EDI data sets.

Company offers great benefits. Candidates must be local to the area or willing to relocate themselves. Contact us today for more information.

title: IMS
description:
#6260
Local Only
W2 Only
No Corp to Corp
No Sponsorship
No third party candidates considered for this position

Our direct client in the greater Irvine, CA area has an immediate opening for an experienced Product Owner and Technical Analyst within the financial services or healthcare/data privacy domains.

Successful candidates will be high energy and comfortable working in a fast-paced, Agile environment. Other required attributes are: Analysis, communicating with team members and expressing thought leadership effectively, successfully delivering on commitments to meet deadlines, and passion for creating the best, world-class software products.

Description:
Ideal candidates will have a strong drive for results, interpersonal skills, positive attitude and be comfortable managing and coordinating cross functional teams. Must have a strong knowledge of Agile methodology and business acumen to prioritize competing user stories. In addition, strong organization, planning skills with a consistent track record for delivering commitments on time are required. Work will be performed in a fast paced, high communication environment where collaboration with the key stakeholders, product management, and development teams is key to day-to-day success.

Responsibilities include:

  • Interfacing with business unit product, architecture, engineering, and infrastructure teams to capture requirements
  • Analyzing relevant business unit documents to create clear business and technical requirement specifications
  • Analyzing technical and product requirements and distilling into epics and user stories
  • Engaging with scrum teams to clarify requirements working closely with software engineers and DevOps engineers.
  • Supporting backlog prioritization and road-map prioritization
  • Providing analysis to support resource and financial planning
  • Driving technical and product issues through to resolution
  • Facilitating management of technical and product risks through agreeing and tracking mitigating actions
  • Analyzing data providers and data agents to inform the data strategy and agree tactical actions

Required skills and experience:

  • 5+ years of experience designing or building software products within two or more of the following domains: Financial, Healthcare, Data Privacy. (HIPAA knowledge from a product standpoint is highly preferred.)
  • Comfortable operating in a variety of capacities including leading, supporting, responsible and accountable
  • Know how to cut through ambiguity to identify the core priorities
  • Able to influence cross-functional teams which include senior executive leaders
  • Able to identity and manage risk in a thoughtful, wise, and logical manner
  • Able to understand how strategy, sales, product, engineering, marketing, accounting, and operations are intertwined
  • 4-year degree in computer science or software engineering

If qualified and interested in this opportunity, please reply to JO #6260 with current resume and hourly rate requirements.

title: Scientific Research Corporation
description:
Scientific Research Corporation is an advanced information technology engineering company that provides innovative products and services to government and private industry, as well as independent institutions. At the core of our capabilities is a seasoned team of highly skilled engineers and scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds. This team is challenged daily to provide cutting edge technology solutions to our clients.



 



PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:





  • Demonstrates relevant expertise in one or more of the following (depending on position) finance, business processes, improvement methods, facilitation, programming, engineering, systems design analysis and evaluation.


  • Direct and participate in projects with an emphasis on planning, design, analysis, testing, integration, validation, implementation, documentation and presentation while providing high-level and extensive knowledge on exceptionally complex problems.


  • Principal contributor to project activities which include: operations, requirements definition, analysis and engineering, system analysis and design, validation and verification, performance analysis, and creating resolutions.


  • Applies advanced business and administrative principles and is capable of providing solutions to exceptionally difficult and narrowly defined programs in an expeditious, efficient, and timely manner.


  • Proficient in both commercial and government programs, policies and software.


  • Highly motivated with demonstrated design and analytical expertise in the areas of complex, mission critical facilities.


  • Carry new design concepts through exploration, development and into deployment/ production.


  • Interface with seniors in industry and government to communicate status and ensure successful program execution.


  • Identify and recommend solutions, enhance, improve, and coordinate detailed analysis


  • Provides information assurance project management and directs and provides work leadership for lower level employees




 



Scientific Research Corporation offers a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages excellence. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.



Scientific Research Corporation is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate in employment.



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: The Jupiter Group
description:
A junior business analyst’s role is to assist the project manager and technical leads and other subject matter professionals in gathering, validating, and documenting various system information and needs.

The job description of the junior business analyst is to carry out an in-depth evaluation and verification of the capabilities of systems, serving as a middleman between the end-users and software developers, to ensure that product information is properly documented, communicated and disseminated.

He/she will participate in the system development life cycle, and as such be available to carryout instructions as directed by the project manager and technical lead. Some additional

  • Create and design project specifications as requested by project manager or workstream managers.
  • Liaise with business units to document business processes.
  • Ensure that various appropriate infrastructure elements, including documents, periodicals, manuals, policy documents, etc. are kept up to date and are available.
  • Create and develop functional requirements of systems to improve quality, performances, external interfaces, and constraints.
  • Carryout analysis of requirements by checking for derived requirements that are logical to customers’ requests.
  • Outline requirement specifications with the use of standard templates for both used cases and detailed software.
  • Manage requirements and ensure they are stored in automated systems.
  • Record, manipulate, and make reports on requirements stored in the rational tool suite.
  • Supervise requirements traceability information and record requirements status during the project.
  • Monitor changes to baseline requirements with the use of effective application of change control processes and tools.
  • Make contributions in the development of Test Plans and Test Scripts and perform test execution as required.
  • Take technical steps to support project needs after receiving training and guidance. (Example: assist with migration or access management changes utilizing a step by step JOB AIDE.
  • Demonstrate above average interpersonal skills and a highly professional demeanor.
  • Can plan, organize, and structure work.
  • Highly skilled in Excel, Word, and other word processing software programs.
  • Knowledge of the Microsoft 365 platform.
  • Showcase good analytical and evaluative skills in tasks.
  • Showcase good written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to multitask.

title: Interactive Business Systems
description:
Job Description

One of our top clients has an immediate need for a Field IT Analyst who will provide support to internal customers residing at GLCCD’s various distribution and manufacturing centers in support of day-to-day IT operations, assist with implementing projects, and other initiatives as assigned.


This position is accountable for resolving high levels of computer and application issues. Additionally, the Field IT Analyst will review the logging and document of solutions to common issues, as well as identify recurring issues and escalate as appropriate. This position works closely with other functions within IT to drive issues to resolution.


Responsibilities include developing SOPs and policies while working with the business to ensure each GLCCD company is being attended to appropriately in terms of application and hardware support. Effective written and verbal communication skills are critical. 

Job Requirements

Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:
• Establish and maintain business relationships with local management at assigned field locations to understand and address their needs.
• Issue resolution for support incidents, demonstrating consistent ability to own issue resolution from start to finish; escalating where appropriate
• Assist internal customers with questions about software and hardware using knowledge base and leveraging other team members
• Assist in solving issues with business applications through personal knowledge and by working with other teams
• Log and maintain support incidents in help desk software
• Plan and manage support projects under the direction of Field IT Manager.
• Responsible for asset management, to include maintaining a current inventory of devices, tracking devices, reclaiming devices no longer in use, etc.
requirements and technical solutions to achieve optimal results
• Assist end-users in finding IT solutions for normal business activities; share ‘Best Practices’ in technology across the group
• Visit field locations as required to support applications and selling/delivery systems, provide assistance with IT hardware, Telecommunications equipment, and LAN/WAN equipment
• Maintain 100% conformance to organizational hardware and software standards and 100% compliance with all corporate standard operating procedures.
• Respond to network infrastructure and file server failures as required to maintain the maximum system uptime of production systems and applications.
• 24/7 support for business impacting P1 and P2 Incidents
• Willing to travel to remote distribution centers up to 40%

title: Hicks Professional Group
description:

Key Responsibilities include:

• Execute the bi-monthly processing of time to include current and prior period timesheet adjustments in Deltek T&E and Costpoint for over 8,000 employees under tight deadlines with focus on accuracy and attention to detail.

• Initiate employee setup in Deltek T&E to enable Time and Expense reporting.

• Cordinate across team members and various internal departments to address time administration, labor processing, and payroll matters.

• Support audits of timekeeping system as requested.

• Support employee outreach efforts to ensure time reporting compliance.

• Process labor distributions to support adjustments made directly in Deltek Costpoint.

• Update process documentation and job aids to ensure accuracy and relevance.

• Support timesheet adjustments requiring administrative action.

title: All Points Logistics, LLC
description:
DESCRIPTION OF POSITION:

  • Utilize monitoring tools, such as Security Information and Event Managers, Intrusion Detection Systems, and Web Content Filtering appliances to dynamically search for potential threat actors, assess risk, and address findings.  Based on findings, craft repeatable processes into automated systems.
  • Collaborate with architects, engineers, and administrators, while translating technical information to non-technical audiences, in order to devise an effective response strategy.
  • Leverage an understanding of vulnerabilities, exploits, and adversary tactics to scope incidents and reduce their impact. Utilize current incident response methodologies to investigate breaches, identify threat actors, gather intelligence, and report findings to decision makers in a timely fashion.
  • Work with a variety of Agency organizations to support policy driven investigative requests, using enterprise computer forensic tools and methods.
  • Assist with the administration of a logging and monitoring solutions, as needed, to enhance existing security posture. 
  • Perform scheduled care and feeding while maintaining compliance standards.  Regularly reassess capabilities for potential improvements.
  • Create or maintain process and change management documentation.
  • Ingest threat intelligence and automate correlation between external threats and current asset elements.
  • Help organizations adopt processes in-line with security standards, and that support the Agency's incident response policy.  Recommend strategies to non-technical audiences that prepare their organizations for potential incursions.
  • Collect data and contribute to user awareness for IT security training.
  • Must be able to work within a team that provides 24x7x365 support coverage to include each team member participating in a one week per month on-call status rotation.

EDUCATION LEVEL:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant area of study (suggested areas of study include Computer Science, Information Technology, and Software Engineering)

SKILLS/CERTIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum of 2-5 years’ experience involving work directly related to listed skills and related to information technology, cybersecurity, security control evaluation and implementation on information technology systems and programs or transferable skills related to information security, incident and risk management.
  • Demonstrated experience working within a Security Operations Center (SOC) or a Computer Incident Response Team (CIRT).
  • Relevant certifications, including government directed certifications, may be required. Qualified candidate would possess at least one of the following certifications and a combination would be highly desirable: MCSE, CCNA, CCNP, ISC, CAP, CISSP, CISM, ISC, ISSMP, GCIH, GCFA, GREM, GNFA
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.'
  • Experience with one or more scripting languages such as Bash, Python, Powershell, VB, Perl, or JavaScript.
  • Strong familiarity with networking, operating systems, databases, and web applications.
  • Knowledge of information security hardening guidelines such as CIS or DoD guidelines.
  • This position requires that the candidate be able to obtain a Secret level security clearance.
  • United States Citizenship Required

YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum 2 - 5 years' experience

SECURITY CLEARANCE LEVEL:

  • Secret

title: kyyba
description:
Kyyba is currently looking for SAP Variant Configuration Analyst in Warminster, Pennsylvania.

 

Tasks Client is seeking a Variant Configuration Analyst to create SAP R/3 Variant Configurator models for new products.

You will be part of The Measurement and Analytics business unit that develops, produces, sells, delivers and services products and solutions to enable industrial and energy customers to operate more efficiently and profitably.  Key product groups within the BU are:  Analytical Instruments, Field Devices, Flow Measurement, Level Measurements, Force Measurement, Instrumentation Service and Process Analytics.

 

Typical duties/responsibilities for project management may include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Create SAP R/3 Variant Configurator models for new products.
  • Troubleshoot and solve sales order entry issues.
  • Create custom order BOMs for special requested orders in SAP R/3
  • Interface/map peripheral software tools to SAP environment
  • Maintain VC objects, BoMs, and routings in SAP R/3 environment.
  • Create and maintain SAP material master (MM) data
  • Build and modify SAP Variant Configurator models accurately and in a timely manner.
  • Create characteristics, classes, configuration profiles, Super BOMs and Super Task lists, object dependencies, Configurable materials, and material variants.
  • Create table and constraints for different combinations and restrictions of the product as per customers’ requirements.
  • Work directly with the plant and coordinate audits of configured BOMs, configured labor routings, and configurable information mapping to shop floor paperwork.
  • Participate in all phases of the variant configuration build from designing, building, testing and release
  • Execute unit testing and integration testing – leading teams of testers when required.
  • Execute PDRs (Product Data Replication)
  • Develop functional specifications and configuration documentation.
  • Provide ongoing production support.
  • Achieve assigned project milestones for assigned projects.
  • Deduce and implement rapid solutions and responses to systems issues as they arise.
  • Act as SAP LO-VC subject matter expert on process improvement projects
  • Create and execute engineering change orders
  • Maintain data Global Sales Tool using Microsoft Excel Tables.

 

Requirements Basic qualifications:

-2 years’ experience and a Bachelor’s degree in a physical sciences discipline

OR

-Experience in interfacing/mapping peripheral software tools such as for order entry and manufacturing processes to SAP environment

-Experience with Sales, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain processes.

Location: Warminster, Pennsylvania, USA

Position: SAP Variant Configuration Analyst

Duration: 24+ months of contract

title: Experienced Recruiting Partners
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Works with business users and DPM to accurately capture requirements, profile data, and translate them into system specifications which include functional & non-functional data and process solutions.
  • Provides consultative guidance to stakeholders on devising effective and efficient approaches to achieve project and program objectives.

title: Computer Aid Inc
description:
*Comprehensive Benefits are available!

Our direct client, located in Camp Hill, PA, has an opening for a Business Analyst to join their growing team. title: Jefferson Parish
description:
Job Purpose:
The ERP Business Analyst will be responsible for leading the planning, assessment, design, and conception of the implementation and ongoing management for an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system and other key IT strategic initiatives. This includes involvement and ownership of activities within the full project lifecycle including: requirements gathering, assessment, RFP process, ERP design, development/configuration, testing, training and change management, deployment, and user support.

Duties:
  • Responsible for managing all phases of an ERP implementation/migration.
  • Leads user research efforts to gain an understanding of stakeholder pain points, challenges, and needs. Builds and delivers design solutions that meet organization’s needs and expectations.
  • Drives innovation and continuous improvement by leveraging the latest industry knowledge. Continually develops skills, knowledge, and abilities by maintaining currency on emerging technologies and approaches. Seeks opportunities to innovate and maximize system functionality.
  • Develop detailed project plans for each area of interest within the organization and ensure project scopes, team responsibilities, milestone dates, and the procurement strategy are clearly stated for all assigned projects.
  • Evaluates and recommends changes to current and future ERP system requirements to meet organizational needs.
  • Coordinating the development and maintenance of project documentation.
  • Holding vendor implementation Project Manager accountable through oversight and reporting for completing the implementation project on time, within scope, within budget and according to the required quality standard (with agreed specifications).
  • Managing project change request process and facilitating the approval process for requests submitted by the vendor implementation Project Manager.
  • Communicates and presents recommended business process improvements and solutions and decision-making rationale in team and client meetings.
  • Reporting project progress, budget and status to the Steering Committee and recommending corrective action when necessary.

Skills/Qualifications:
  • 8+years recent experience with managing large complex ERP projects with a strong preference for experience in Parish (County) or City government.
  • Experience with public procurement processes, Purchasing, Accounting, Budgeting, Human Resources, and Payroll.
  • Experience with IBM iSeries Financial Management is preferred.
  • Ability to provide high level expertise across a broad range of business and IT related subject matter areas.
  • Experience performing cost benefit analysis regarding new ERP feature development.
  • Experience with procurement policies and procedures.
  • Experience with managing software licensing, IT security standards/requirements, and backup & recovery procedures for production and test environments.
  • Experience with financial audit requirements for business and financial applications.
  • Prior experience leading ERP-related transformation initiatives and general IT background experience in ERP vendor management and negotiations.
  • Proficiency with ERP software and principles, enterprise project management software, and project portfolio management software.
  • PMP certification is preferred.
  • Experience with NIST, HIPAA and PII.
  • Experience with business analytics and business intelligence software.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, MS Project).
  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems or related field is required, with a Master of Science or MBA preferred.

title: National Engineering Resources, Inc.
description:
Sr Business Analyst

In this role, you will work directly with manufacturing leaders, business users, and IT teammates to plan, define, design, specify, test, train, implement, and support manufacturing solutions. This is a direct hire position located in the beautiful Shenandoah Valley, VA. area. For immediate consideration/more information apply online or send an email to Brad Coleman at brad.coleman@nerinc.com with your updated resume.    

 

Responsibilities

  • Lead collection and analysis of data and information from business users to understand how systems can solve business problems, and identify opportunities for process improvement.
  • Engage and lead collection and analysis of project engagements, documenting project scope (objectives, deliverables, critical success factors, assumptions, global and regional considerations, and resource requirements), prioritization, cost/benefit, potential risks, and feasibility.
  • Research potential solutions (package and custom) and execute software sourcing/selection process.
  • Define and review content for user guides, training classes, and related
  • May lead the development of functional test scripts and verification activities to ensure solutions meet business needs.
  • May lead testing activities with appropriate technical and customer personnel, to ensure that customer interests are represented in all testing stages.
  • Responsible for traceability of requirements, translation of business and system requirements into functional and technical specifications. Alerts team leadership when traceability appears weak, or is lost. When changes to the requirements occur, performs the impact analysis and recommends follow-through actions.
  • Forges a network of beneficial relationships with all levels, including management, within IT organizations and the customers of IT in order to establish mutual trust and provide a foundation for high level project partnership. Initiates and develops working relationships with internal and external groups.
  • Applies influence, negotiates, and mediates discussions needed to make progress towards achieving business goals and objectives. May lead conflict resolution activities.
  • Understands the business needs at a strategic level and can correlate problems to one or more processes, tools or systems.
  • Provides production support for business applications and processes. Excellent problem-solving skills is required.
  • May lead interactions with third parties including application service providers and partners.

 

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of Oracle Applications experience implementing and supporting, in at least 3 of the following Oracle modules (Purchasing, WMS, ASCP, WIP, Cost, BOM, MRP, Order Management and Inventory).
  • 7+ years' experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Strong understanding of manufacturing processes
  • High-level experience implementing, modifying, extending and supporting Oracle EBS manufacturing-related modules.
  • Experience in Discrete Manufacturing is required
  • Experience in a configure/build/engineer-to-order environment would be ideal.
  • Has established knowledge & understanding of functional testing scenarios at both business and technical levels.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead, manage, and participate in cross-functional business projects.
  • Demonstrated ability to gather, clarify, quantify and document business requirements.
  • Able to suggest, define and implement business improvement projects.
  • Knowledge of lean manufacturing techniques is highly desirable.
  • Some experience using SQL.

For immediate consideration apply online or email brad.coleman@nerinc.com

Very competitive salary, great benefits and relocation package offered and negotiable.

Visa sponsorship is not authorized for this position now or in the future.

title: Staffing Now
description:
Description



Our client's Financial Engineering team is seeking a Project Manager/Business Analyst to assist the Senior Project Manager in managing the delivery of a diverse portfolio of analytical projects to internal customers in the Investments & Capital Markets division.
This challenging and rewarding position gives you an opportunity to work with various technical teams, senior leadership, and business users.
Core Responsibilities

  • Support multiple, simultaneous projects in an Agile development environment involving different types of technical and business partners.
  • Develop project plans, including project schedule and timeline, and track projects according to schedule. Accurately assess, manage, and report risks and issues to project timing, cost, and quality.
  • Demonstrate ownership of problems, issues, and requests from start to finish - facilitate appropriate hand offs and stakeholder engagement while ensuring resolution.
  • Maintain customer relationships to ensure the project implementation and prioritization fulfills business objectives. Help business and technology adapt to changing priorities swiftly and efficiently.
  • Negotiate as needed with customers, technology managers, and subject matter experts to promote efficient solutions and smooth implementation.
  • Establish and maintain relationships with peers. Find common ground and get cooperation when dealing with conflict.
  • Serve as a key point of contact in routine customer briefings on different aspects of assigned initiatives.
  • Develop communication plans and effectively communicate verbally (e.g. day-to-day discussions, team meetings) and in writing (status reports).
  • Perform business and quantitative analyses with the guidance of the development team to inform implementation strategies and help resolve risks and issues.
  • Develop an integrated understanding of business needs and technical implementation details sufficient to interface between business and technical teams as needed and help synthesize requirements and constraints from both parties.
  • Coordinate the user acceptance testing process for new features including customer satisfaction and governance process completion.


Required skills

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 1+ years of work experience
  • Excellent analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills demonstrated through coursework or internship/work experience
  • Strong leadership capabilities demonstrated through an internship/work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
  • Demonstrated exceptional ability to communicate complex ideas effectively - both verbally and in writing
  • Results-driven, detail-oriented, curious self-starter who quickly grasps new technical and business concepts
  • Demonstrates excellent organizational skills and customer relationship management skills
  • Skilled in Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)


Preferred skills:

  • Bachelor's degree with a concentration in Economics, Finance, Accounting, or a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) discipline
  • Experience with Tableau, Power BI, or similar data visualization software
  • Experience with Agile methodologies
  • Experience with SQL and/or statistical packages such as R Studio, Matlab, or Python
  • Experience in Financial Services, especially Mortgage Industry, a plus

title: Axiom Systems, Inc
description:
Candidates must be local to Frederick, MD.

If not local to Frederick, must be willing to relocate.  

Willing to travel up to 50-75%

MUST HAVE EDI EXPERIENCE WITHIN THE HEALTHCARE PAYOR MARKET TO BE CONSIDERED.

 

AXIOM Systems, Inc. is the premier healthcare IT and business solutions provider specializing in support for the system integration, implementation, enterprise reporting, and HIPAA and EDI needs of healthcare organizations.  AXIOM is unique in its ability to develop and implement practical, effective solutions based on its deep knowledge of the healthcare industry.

 

To support its clients AXIOM is looking to fill an EDI Business Analyst/QA Tester position. The ideal candidate will have experience working as part of a team or as a team lead within a pre-packaged product environment and will:

 

Provide business and technical consulting and implementation services to clients related to assessment, and implementation of AXIOM’s EDI Gateway application TransSend. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) working within the Product Development team and with clients to identify impacts, analyze issues and implement product solutions based on customer’s business needs.  Perform client assessments, write detailed reports and specifications and support and perform activities such as design, testing and system integration. 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Business Analysis: 

  • Must have strong EDI experience, required
  • Must have at least 5+ years Business Analysis experience.
  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience working in a payer or provider environment.
  • 5+ years of IT Business Analysis experience gathering/documenting business requirements and translating into technical specifications.
  • General knowledge of healthcare operations, payer business processes and/or provider and EDI infrastructures.
  • Strong understanding of business rules.
  • Must have previous experience with HIPAA transaction sets.
  • Experience in HIPAA logical mapping and system implementation is preferred.
  • Healthcare operational experience is not required, but is highly preferred.  
  • Claims, enrollment and pricing configuration is a plus. 
  • Previous experience with assignment leadership a plus. 
  • Strong experience with XML and XSLT.  Need to be able to map EDI and flat files to XML Schemas and vice versa.  Experience with XMLSpy a plus.
  • Experience in implementation of payer or provider applications – (examples: AMISYS, HealthRules, Facets, QNXT, etc.).
  • Experience working with MS SQL Server 2005 and higher or PL/SQL, VB, Java, UNIX, C and C++.

Testing Experience:

  • 5+ years experience with QA Methodology and QA Validations to ensure the Quality Assurance Control.
  • 5+ years experience in creation and interpretation of business specifications and develop Test Plans, Test Scripts, Test Cases and Execution.
  • 5+ years experience with automated QA Testing tools, such as Selenium, QTP, Jira, Zephyr, etc. 
  • 5+ years experience with manual QA Testing tools, such as JMeter, Roadrunner, TestLink, etc. 

 Additional Experience:

  • Excellent organizational, and communication skills (verbal and writing).
  • Self-starter, problem solver.
  • Clearly articulate (both verbal and written) project status and issues management.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in relevant field required.

 

AXIOM provides a comprehensive benefits package, including leave of a standard 26 days a year. Health insurance is provided by United Healthcare and coverage for Dental, STD, LTD and Life is provided by Guardian. Additional benefits include Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k) matching, cancer insurance and more.

title: Duetix Designs LLC
description:
BSOC Wideband Signals Analyst (BWSA)

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

The Battalion SATCOM Operations Center (BSOC) Wideband Signals Analyst (BWSA) will be proficient in the duties of the Transmission Controller position at the Army’s Wideband SATCOM Operations Centers (WSOC). The BWSA provides oversight and monitoring of the Wideband SATCOM Operations and Management System Network (WSOMSNet) and engages Wideband SATCOM Operations Centers (WSOC) to maintain situational awareness of Wideband MILSATCOM’s space-based assets and ground control infrastructure status. The contractor in the BSOC will report operational and maintenance issues to 53D Signal Bn Commander and S3 Staff. The BWSA utilizes the DOSS, CNPS, WRMS, and GTC3S as the primary tools to perform their oversight and monitoring tasks.  The BWSA coordinates through the Senior TS SME and appropriate agencies.

The BWSA will take daily direction from the Senior TC SME but will report to the L3Harris site manager for all corporate functions.

MAJOR JOB ACTIVITIES:

The BWSA’s duties include but are not limited to:

  • Monitor and maintain Situational Awareness of all activities related to the 5 WSOCs
  • Be familiar with and follow all Transmission Controller Operating Instructions contained in the Wideband Controllers Guide (WCG).
  • Review the Control Change Queue in CNPS; document changes to CNPS plans,
  • Perform Mission Planning duties on WGS and DSCS satellites in a backup role as necessary.
  • Certified WPC and DPC Controller with in the first year of hire date
  • Verify the performance of transmission links for all assigned satellites by using the WRMS.
  • Analyze appropriate 8-Hour Reports to verify transmission and terminal performance and status.
  • Engage with WSOCs to perform adjustments necessary to achieve established operating parameters.
  • Assist the any WSOC in identifying, troubleshooting, and eliminating anomalous transmission and payload conditions.
  • Report operational and maintenance issues to 53D Signal Battalion Commander and S3 Staff. 
  • Perform all required reporting to the appropriate agencies.
  • Review the Hazardous Condition (HAZCON) Log using DIMS.
  • Complete and submit DORs in accordance with the applicable guidance.
  • Coordinate enterprise terminal ASIs and emergency outages with appropriate agencies.
  • Review relevant DIMS Reports daily.
  • Review alarms for the past 24 hours in WRMS daily.
  • Complete and submit AARs in accordance with the applicable guidance.
  • Maintain situational awareness of WSOMS network with SolarWinds.
  • Oversee circuit testing and direct TMDE setup and use.
  • Interface with all SME’s and program assets to assist with fault isolation.
  • Assist with primary troubleshooting and anomaly resolution for all mission system within the 5 WSOC’s
  • First level trainer of all systems and subsystems for the BSOC personnel.
  • Assist with software and hardware installations in the BSOC
  • Propagate a culture of safety in all aspects of the job.

Preferred Skills:

  • Ability to plan, implement, verify and troubleshoot local and wide-area enterprise networks.
  • Strong enterprise network troubleshooting (Cisco IOS(s), IP routing, EIGRP)
  • Strong skill set with Microsoft Office software applications.
  • DoD 8570.01-M IAT Level 3 certification (e.g. CASP+ CE, CCNP Security, CISA, CISSP (or Associate), GCED, or GCIH)
  • Experience implementing patches, scanning, remediating findings, auditing
  • Working knowledge of RMF and cybersecurity requirements
  • Previous experience supporting DoD/government customers
  • Demonstrated ability to work and grow in a dynamic, fast paced, team-oriented environment
  • Ability to travel up to 10%
  • Establish and maintain up-to-date cybersecurity configurations based on DISA STIGs and IAVM Notices
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint
  • Support critical operations during standard and non-standard working hours

Experience/Education:

  • Associate’s Degree in Electronics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.  2 years of related experience may be substituted for 1 year of education.
  • 4 years’ experience working as a military SATCOM controller
  • Security+ or equivalent vendor certification is preferred.
  • Experience in the use of IT tools

Clearance:

  • Top Secret

LABOR CATEGORY TITLE:

Level 4

title: Assurance Technology Corporation
description:
Individual would track contract funding and develop contract expenditure projections in Excel.  Responsibilities would include; compile monthly financial reports for multiple prime contracts, screen technical reports and write a summarized statement of work accomplished and completed for monthly status reports, create visual graphics to display projections, organize contract information into presentable and accurate documents in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.  Candidates must be able to multitask and assist in other areas such as Purchasing, Receivables, Subcontracts, and Security.  Experience in government contracting reporting is a “plus” and Individual must be a U.S. Citizen capable of obtaining and maintaining a Top Secret security clearance.

Submit resumes to jobs@assurtech.com

Assurance Technology Corporation (ATC) is a leader in the design and development of high technology electronics systems for the space and communications industries.  ATC has a successful history in space and ground systems research and development programs yielding advanced technology high reliability hardware and software as well as providing engineering and management consulting and high reliability test services.  ATC offers excellent benefits including company paid medical and dental insurance, a deferred profit sharing plan, and a 401(k) savings plan.  Our Massachusetts facilities are located northwest of Boston convenient to routes 2, 3, 128, and 495. Our Alexandria, Virginia location is just south of the Woodrow Wilson Bridge and within a one mile radius of two major North/South roads, Route 1 and George Washington Memorial Parkway.  Visit our website at http://www.assurtech.com.

Assurance Technology Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer to include Veterans and individuals with disabilities.
