title: Innova Electronics
description:
Quality Assurance Analyst

Innova Electronics Corporation is a leading supplier of test equipment and diagnostic reporting products for the automotive aftermarket, offering high quality products, innovative diagnostics and value to customers. Distributed from facilities in the U.S. and Canada, all Innova products are researched, developed and designed at the company’s headquarters in Irvine, California. Innova currently has an opening for a Quality Assurance Analyst that will be responsible for the background performing test approaches, estimates, plans, and coordinates testing for complex integrated systems.

QUALIFICATIONS:

 Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in STEM field preferred.

  • 1 – 3 Years’ experience in the software QA role.
  • Experience with JIRA or equivalent issue management tool
  • Conceptual knowledge of Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and Kanban methodologies
  • HTML, JavaScript, and Python knowledge preferred. WordPress is a plus.
  • Attention to detail is a requirement.
  • Automotive knowledge is a plus

 

BASIC FUNCTION:                         

The functions of the Quality Assurance Analyst require experienced background performing test approaches, estimates, plans, and coordinates testing for complex integrated systems.

  • Create test cases and test scenarios for software and web applications.
  • Provide input on requirements and advise resolutions on defects and enhancements.
  • Offer solutions for complex test approaches and plans.
  • Participate in requirements analysis, user story, and test case development/execution.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES:

Review Business Level Requirements

  • Review Business/Marketing level requirements to recognize the deliverable objectives and create a test plan.
  • Review Sprint Level Requirements
  • Review the software team sprint requirements before receiving testing releases.
  • Reference requirements during testing to outline corrections for all reported defects.
  • Creates, Gather, and Improve Test Cases
  • Create multiple test cases based on the objective and by reviewing requirements.
  • Offer easy-to-understand test scenarios for QC and Software team to utilize during deployments.
  • Perform Sprint Testing / Validation
  • Swiftly but thoroughly perform testing on sprint deployments.
  • Perform regression testing on sandbox and production environments.
  • Document all details of testing to share with appropriate internal stakeholders
  • Include references (images/videos) with complex defect(s) and/or enhancement(s).
  • Maintain Test Result Backlogs
  • Develop and maintain a backlog of the results on applications such as Excel, JIRA, BugTracker, or Trello.
  • Gather test results of other team members and merge into the test result backlog.
  • Define issue types and severity based on user experience, objective, and timeline.
  • Create Sprint Level Requirements
  • Create software-oriented requirements based on defects (or enhancements) in the test result backlog.
  • Document references (images/videos) and other elements to clearly outline the defect and corrective action.
  • Cross-Platform Testing
  • Tests across multiple platforms/devices, as necessary, to ensure consistent user experience across platforms.

  • We offer a competitive salary and benefits package that includes:-
  • Great work environment
  • Medical & dental
  • 401K Plan
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid vacation and 9 paid holidays

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

title: Peterson Technology Partners
description:
Client is seeking Business Systems analysts to coordinate and propagate the Cybersecurity Step Change Program level designs, operational readiness, non-functional requirements, and guiding principles and practices (GPPs) with the Client. The role is responsible for coordinating with all stakeholders possessing applications/systems that are in scope to follow the defined business requirements, designs, operational readiness, non-functional requirements, and GPPs. This includes working closely with the SMEs, Consultants, and business partners in gathering the necessary requirements; the individual will also collaborate with AIS team members to create the strategies for protecting our control environment

 

BA

  • Coordinating with all Client's possessing applications that use and store personally identifiable information, to follow the defined guidelines for applications in scope.
  • Build and leverage strong relationships with internal partners including Compliance and Privacy, Information Solutions, ICS, Architects, Project Managers and DCIOs
  • Develop business requirements in collaboration with our business partners using multiple methods including: interviews, document analysis, workshop facilitation, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, user stories, scenarios, business analysis, data mapping documents, task and workflow analysis.
  • Ability to work across teams to research undocumented business rules to improve requirements
  • Critically review all requests to determine viability, alternatives, value to the customer. Analyze tradeoffs between usability and technical viability
  • Create the following written deliverables where appropriate: Checklists, Business & Functional Requirements, Storyboards, Process Flows, Use Cases, User Stories, Screen Designs & behavior, Mockups, Mapping Documents, Training & Operations Guides, Estimates, Software Release Notes, Demonstrate expert use of appropriate tools and techniques to elicit and define requirements that address more complex processes and projects of moderate and high complexity
  • Be proficient in analyzing requirements and creating functional requirements documents for initiatives, leveraging more advanced technical skills.
  • Be proficient in following the change control process to manage changes to baselined deliverables and scope for projects of moderate and high complexity.

About the Company:

Peterson Technology Partners (PTP) has been Chicago's premier Information Technology (IT) staffing, consulting, and recruiting firm for over 22+ years. Named after Chicago's historic Peterson Avenue, PTP has built its reputation by developing lasting relationships, leading digital transformation, and inspiring technical innovation throughout Chicagoland.

Based in Park Ridge, IL, PTP's 250+ employees have a narrow focus on a single market (Chicago) and expertise in 4 innovative technical areas;

 

  • Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning/Data Science

  • Robotics/Robotic Process Automation (RPA)

  • Cyber/Data/Information Security

  • DevOps/DevSecOps

 

PTP exists to ensure that all of our partners (clients and candidates alike) make the best hiring and career decisions.

title: Delta Dental
description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Joining Delta Dental means joining a culture focused on fostering development, building genuine connections, recognizing each other’s strengths and sharing in successes. 

This position is responsible for providing IT first level support, through various contact channels, as part of the Service Center. The Service Center is the enterprise single point of contact for handling IT incidents and service requests. All requests are handled in accordance to incident management and request fulfillment processes and is accountable to Service Center objectives.

How you will make an impact:

  • Answers incoming telephone, voicemail, e‐mail and in-­person requests for assistance from users experiencing problems with computer­‐related technologies such as Windows administration, Citrix, and remote connection support.
  • Recognizes problems, researches, isolates, resolves and follows‐up, as well as logs and tracks calls using an incident management tracking tool.
  • Provides remote support and resolutions pertaining to client PC, laptops, virtual desktop, mobile devices, etc. and production business applications.
  • Identifies, troubleshoots, and resolves hardware (non-­dispatched) and software failures that prevent a user from employing an existing IT service.
  • Manages their own queue and resolves the issue within the established SLA. IT issues are registered by the Analyst in an Incident Management tracking tool and assigned either to themselves or escalated to a queue managed by additional support teams.
  • Moves the location of existing IT resources by adding new software, upgrading software, and changing the configuration of user settings in software (non-­‐dispatched).
  • Sets up new users, modifies access for existing users and installs standard applications in the desktop environment (no Security or permissions access is handled by Analyst).
  • Documents the processes needed to support any new software that is added to the environment as it relates to the desktop image or associated functions.
  • Other tasks as assigned by department and/or division management.

What we look for:

  • Detail oriented and excellent problem‐solving capabilities.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Highly organized with strong time and project management skills; solid multi-tasking abilities.
  • Knowledge of ITIL Service Operation, specifically Service Desk processes.
  • Good working knowledge of the TCP/IP protocol suite and networking sufficient to troubleshoot workstation connectivity in a switched Ethernet LAN/WAN environment.
  • High school diploma or GED, but candidates with proven experience will not be excluded from consideration.
  • An Associate degree or equivalent is preferred.
  • A minimum of 2 years related experience.
  • Certification in at least one of these areas is preferred: Microsoft Operating System, Microsoft Office Suite Certification and Help Desk Support Center certification.
  • Experience with use and troubleshooting of claims processing or other non‐shrink wrap/standard business application preferred.
  • Minimum of 2 years prior level one (helpdesk support) experience in Windows 7­‐10 based environment.
  • Must be experienced with latest MS Office applications, and installing and configuring applications.
  • Ability to troubleshoot desktop computers, laptops, printers, and smartphones.
  • Must have security and user account administration skills to create and troubleshoot access to printers, network applications, server based group shared drives, VPN access, Exchange, and Citrix support.

Benefits and perks:

  • 12 days starting vacation plus 12 holidays and your birthday off!
  • Multiple medical insurance options: 100% paid or low cost premiums
  • 100% paid dental insurance
  • 100% paid vision insurance
  • Onsite gym and/or gym discount and fitness incentive
  • Culture of learning: substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skills
  • Career growth: we love promoting from within
  • Strong commitment to work/life balance  
  • Technology allowance
  • Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities
#LI-JS1

At Delta Dental we:
Promote accountability, integrity and collaboration: Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.
Foster professional development: Our employees take ownership of developing themselves and others through coaching, mentoring and providing/being open to constructive feedback and identifying learning opportunities.
Value customers and cultivate positive experiences: Our employees take time to build rapport with customers, while anticipating and exceeding their needs to ensure positive outcomes.  

If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!

Follow us@lifeatDDins on Instagram,lifeatDDins on Facebook,@lifeatDDins on Twitter
 
ABOUT Delta Dental
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. As an employee you’ll take part in our mission to become the trusted health partner by collaborating with our communities and employees to reimagine and deliver new possibilities in an ever-changing environment. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.
 
We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.
 
Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Akimeka LLC
description:
Help Desk Specialist I

 

At Akimeka, meeting high-priority challenges with high-impact solutions is what we're all about. Whether it's helping transform the future of military medicine,providing timely, trusted access to classified information,or saving lives by enhancing 911 services, we are dedicated to delivering innovative IT solutions.

 

Akimeka has an opportunity for an experienced Help Desk Specialist I. This position will be located at Ft. Belvoir, VA. Active Secret clearance or higher is required.

 

Job Summary:

 

Applications Support Specialist will provide application support for unclassified and classified web-based applications

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: (Not listed in order of importance; other duties may be assigned)

 

  • Provide Tier 1 application support for unclassified and classified Web-based applications
  • Under minimal supervision provides front-line support to end users for PC, server or mainframe applications and hardware. Interacts with network services, software systems engineering and/or applications development to restore service and/or identify core problems.
  • Receive inbound customer calls and email inquiries, analyze problems, research solutions and provide solid answers easily understood by the customers
  • Stimulates or recreates user problems to resolve operating difficulties.
  • Ensure issues are fully documented in the help desk ticketing system application
  • Escalate non-Tier 1 issues to Tier 2
  • Trains end-users on software packages and standard IT procedures as required; participates in new application rollouts, testing and special projects as needed.
  • Master the features and functionality of the supported software applications
  • Maintain knowledge of software updates and enhancements
  • Provide training on specific tasks in the application

 

Qualifications:

 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

Education and/or Experience:

 

  • Bachelor's degree preferred
  • Security+ certification preferred. Required within 6 months of employment. 
  • 2 years’ work experience in the IT/Help Desk fields.
  • Equivalent combination of knowledge and specialized experience may be acceptable in lieu of a degree.
  • Prior medical and/or military experience desired
  • Active Secret Clearance

 

Knowledge/Skills Required

 

  • Proficient in Windows 2000/XP, MS Office, and use of the internet
  • Prior experience working with Apple/Mac systems desired
  • Strong interpersonal communication and customer service skills
  • Minimum 4 years’ experience in a customer support or help desk role
  • Proficient in Windows 2000/XP, MS Office, and use of the internet
  • Must have the ability to multi-task and work well in a fast paced team environment
  • Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Prior medical and/or military experience desired

  

 

Physical Demands and Work Environment:

 

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

Physical demands: Employee will occasionally need to lift or move equipment weighing up to 15 pounds. Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard. Hearing and speaking to exchange information. Seeing to view computer monitor. Sitting for extended periods of time.

 

Work environment: Professional office environment: temperature controlled office building, low noise level, standard office lighting.

 

Akimeka is a growing IT provider who recognizes the value of its employees. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401k plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; paid vacation and sick time; and 10 paid holidays.  

 

 

Akimeka is proud to be an EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability Employer.

title: Gross Builders
description:
Analyze the Company's financial status by collecting, monitoring, and studying data.  Prepare budget and Forecast reports with actual and projected results and recommend actions to management.  Provide leadership in financial management.  Create and maintain strong and open communication with management and support the organization's overall finance function. Protect the confidentiality of the company. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but not limited to the following:

  • Analyze and interpret data and making comparative analyses, monitoring variances, and studying proposed changes in methods.
  • Guide cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing rigorous financial policies, procedures, and best practices recognized through industry standards.
  • Provide trends and forecast summary reports
  • Assist in preparing/analyzing apartment community budgets.
  • Understand the relationship between a company's fiscal behavior and marketplace demands and trends shaping the real estate, construction, and residential property management industries.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills including the ability to explain financial jargon in simple terms.
  • Analyze a variety of scenarios, draw suitable conclusions and clearly outline both the benefits and detriments to alternate courses of action.
  • Recommend innovations to increase productivity in areas including, but not limited to developing automated accounting applications, data collection, streamlining the recording process that drives accuracy, coordinate information requirements, etc.

 

About The Company

Gross Residential is a dynamic real estate development, construction, and property management firm with approximately 325 employees and 38 locations throughout northeast Ohio, Tennessee, Alabama, South Carolina, and North Carolina.  We develop projects and oversee the construction of apartments, townhouses, and condominiums.  We market and sell the homes, while maintaining ownership of and managing the apartment communities.

 Celebrating over 100 years in business, we offer a pleasant, team-oriented, professional environment, competitive salary, health and dental benefits, Health Savings Account, a generous paid time package, and 401k with company match!

title: Boyd Corporation
description:
With over 90 years of customer-focused performance, Boyd Corporation has evolved as a market leader in engineered rubber, plastic, metal, flexible environmental sealing & energy management solutions. Boyd is a unique supplier, valuing our people as our most important resource. With our best-in-class technical sales associates, sales support service teams & field application, quality, & manufacturing engineers, Boyd offers total global solutions to enhance the performance & manufacturability of your products. Our cost-effective, tight-tolerance, global manufacturing capabilities ensure superior total landed cost as well as reliability throughout the product life cycle.


ROLE SUMMARY


We are looking for a Financial Data Analyst / Steward to join our team in Pleasanton, CA. This role will be responsible for data integrity, identifying and supporting business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs of the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) group. The ideal candidate is conscientious, with a keen attention to detail, highly analytical, excellent project management skills and is highly personable. This individual will join a team engaged in the transformation of Boyd's ERP and EPM architectures, from one that has historically been heavily reliant on manual processes to one that is innovative, data-rich, and technology-centric. As part of the team, the analyst will be responsible for harnessing the organization data enabling data driven decisions that Sales and Operations are facing on a daily basis. This role will require the ability to smoothly execute and implement solutions while also effectively communicating with stakeholders.


ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Ensure the integrity of our financial data working collaboratively with Sales, Operations and IT to provide value-added, data driven analysis that will support operational improvements and EBITDA improvements

  • Optimize workflows and communications of financial data including designing and document dashboards, alerts, and reports

  • Create processes and procedures along with access controls ensuring compliance and security of our data

  • Convert data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions, with a strong interface between Sales and Operations

  • Leverage data mining and business intelligence tools to analyze large amounts of data identifying relationships and patterns within the data.

  • Conduct financial research, modeling, and analysis to support critical decisions; develop actionable recommendations based on research; effectively communicate analyses and recommendations to the Finance leadership team through both oral presentations and written documents

  • Identify and support business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs of the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) group

  • Provide support for finance initiatives and projects, as assigned

title: Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies
description:
Ke'aki Technologies, LLC. is looking for a qualified FINANCE ANALYST - DATA to support our contract with Pacific Missile Range Facility (PMRF) in Kekaha, HI. 

DESCRIPTION OF RESPONSIBILITIES:

Performs financial data analysis for the purpose of Financial Status Reporting and reconciling Manu Kai costs with Government’s BIS accounting system in conformance with company and Governmental accounting principles, policies and objectives.

Major Job Activities:

  • Primary areas of responsibility include in-depth analysis of financial transactions and transaction line item reconciliation between multiple Manu Kai source systems, Deltek Cost Point and the government’s Business Information System (BIS).
  • Determines and audits account designations and distributes charges and credits in association with data reconciliation.
  • Prepares and audits financial records for reconciliation and final closeouts.
  • Assist in developing, updating and/or revising company accounting processes, controls and procedures relating to reconciliations and close outs to ensure all contractual requirements are met.
  • Assist in developing and implementing financial controls and procedures to meet corporate and government compliance standards relating to reconciliations.
  • Prepares and analyzes financial status reports and recommends solutions on problem areas.
  • Prepares, reviews and submits Contract Data Requirements in a timely manner
  • Coordinate with various departments on the project including Finance, Contracts, Purchasing, Supply/Logistics and Public Works in order to research and verify cost data accuracy.
  • Research and identify system errors to assist in reconciliation efforts.
  • Performs other duties as assigned by Supervisor/Manager.

Environment: Customer contact, extended work day and field assignment. Electronics shop environment and remote site support.

Physical Elements: Must be able to lift, push or pull a limit of 1-10 lbs.Continuous sitting.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Experience:

  • Two years’ experience in the Accounting field.
  • Knowledge of Government contract and FAR administration required.
  • Must be capable of operating personal computers, computer software and/or accounting systems and standard office equipment.
  • Must be knowledgeable in spreadsheet software and word processing programs. Two years working knowledge of MS Office.  Advanced Excel skills to include pivot tables, array formulas, vlookup formulas, etc.
  • Must possess working understanding of performing efficient reconciliation of the database using mutually exclusive data subsets.
  • Must possess the ability to research and identify transactions in error and made correcting entries to ensure data accuracy.
  • Must have experience working with Government systems.
  • Must have a thorough working knowledge of BOS/ROS Government contract.
  • Experience with Government contracts and FAR administration required.
  • Must be possess the following PC Skills:MS Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point

DEGREE/EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline preferred.
  • Specific work experience in the Accounting field may be substituted for the degree.

CITIZENSHIP/SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:

Secret security clearance is not required however; applicants selected must be a US Citizen in order to apply for a Common Access card (CAC) identification.

Ke`aki Technologies LLC is a fast-growing government service provider. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401K plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; tuition reimbursement; paid vacation and sick time; and 10 paid holidays. Ke`aki Technologies is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer of individuals with disabilities and veterans. We are proud to state that we do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you are a person with a disability and you need an accommodation during the application process, please click   here to request accommodation. We E-Verify all employees.

The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is comprised of industry-recognized government service firms designated as Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO)-owned and 8(a) certified businesses. The Family of Companies (FOCs) includes Ke`aki Technologies, Laulima Government Solutions, Kūpono Government Services, and Kapili Services, Po`okela Solutions,  Kīkaha Solutions, LLC,  and Pololei Solutions, LLC.  Alaka`ina Foundation activities under the 501(c)3 principally benefit the youth of Hawaii through charitable efforts which includes providing innovative educational programs that combine leadership, science & technology, and environmental stewardship.

For additional information, please visit   www.alakainafoundation.com.

title: MilliporeSigma
description:
A career with MilliporeSigma is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 57,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others. MilliporeSigma is a business of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany.

 

Your Role:
  • This position will align with specific SAP modules (QM, PP) supporting Quality Management and have the following responsibilities:
  • Hands-on team leader working to create and support system solutions
  • Leads the process of combining business process and system functions into working solutions to meet business needs
  • Analyzes business problems and opportunities; evaluate and define business processes and systems to meet user requirements
  • Leads projects and tasks to drive significant collaborative IS/Business solutions to improve profitability and manage project deliverables according to project plan. This includes but is not limited to the following: resource requirements, testing, training, as well as orchestrating each go-live.
  • Actively gather and document business and functional requirements. Investigate, determine and recommend solutions for change requests and coordinate with IS to present functional and technical options
  • Participate in functional process improvements and work as a liaison with IS to recommend potential IS solutions
  • Facilitate communication with IS to ensure that business customer's requirements are translated into design specifications
  • Maintains communication with other colleagues or joint user/system teams to ensure that cross-functional requirements are compatible with overall business needs and that they can be integrated
  • Actively lead or participate in end-to-end applications implementation, upgrades or improvement projects from assessment to production support.
  • Responsible for driving solutions, be it enhancement requests or change management through the organization. Will work with sites to ensure they have a business case justification for localized enhancements.
  • Lead test design, testing, user-documentation, training development and training
  • Ensures realistic test plans for the testing of all new applications prior to implementation and monitors the execution of those plans
  • Develop tools and processes for analyzing master data to ensure implemented processes are functioning as expected. This includes developing reports and data downloads for user analysis as well as developing master data audit processes and procedures
  • Trains subject matter experts (SME's) in the use of new functionality as well as master data audit and maintenance
  • Oversees availability of adequate end-user and system documentation
  • Using influence techniques and able to lead small groups to achieve project deliverables
  • Effectively lead and implement change management
  • Domestic and international travel may be required (no more than 10%)
  • Work hours change depending on phase of a given project
  • Saturday and Sunday work possible around project implementations



Who You Are:



Minimum Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree
  • 5+ years of operational experience
  • 5+ years of SAP experience (Subject Matter Expert Level)


Preferred Qualifications:
  • Some experience in Project Management
  • Detailed working knowledge of the SAP module supporting the given business function (i.e. Procurement, Planning and Scheduling, Quality)
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent PC skills (Word, Visio, Excel)
  • Aptitude for learning other IS systems
  • Superior analytical skills
  • Excellent problem-solving skills


RSRMS

 

What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!

 

Curious? Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com

The Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. title: IAdea America Corp.
description:
Orange County global digital signage company seeks one full-time computer systems analyst to work at its office in Irvine, CA. Candidate must have at least a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering, as well as 36 months of prior computer analyst, software engineer or programmer. This position requires travel approximately 5 to 7 trips per year, to Europe, Taiwan and throughout U.S. to attend trade shows, partner conferences and HQ meetings, with each trip lasting from 3 to 5 days. 

Candidate duties will include:

  • Test, maintain, and monitor computer programs and systems, including coordinating the installation of computer programs and systems;

  • Interview or survey workers, observe job performance or perform the job to determine what information is processed and how it is processed; and

title: Credence Management Solutions LLC
description:
Overview

Credence and its partner, the Public Health Institute (PHI), are both employers for the Global Health Technical Professionals (GHTP) project which provides expertise in support of USAID global health programs. The hiring of this position will be through the PHI and as such the selected person will become a PHI employee.



Summary Statement

The Research, Technology, and Utilization Division (RTU) of the Office of Population and Reproductive Health (PRH) provides technical leadership in building scientific and empirical knowledge and ensures its use in the design and implementation of effective, efficient, high-quality family planning and reproductive health (FP/RH) programs. The objectives of RTU’s research program in Family Planning and Reproductive Health are to provide new and/or improved technologies; improve the quality, accessibility and cost-effectiveness of family planning and related reproductive health services; strengthen developing country institutional capabilities to use research to diagnose and solve service delivery problems; and enhance the dissemination and utilization of research results.

The RTU Division maintains close working relationships with other United States Government Agencies involved in research & development (e.g., the Food and Drug Administration, the National Institutes of Health), United Nation Agencies (e.g., the World Health Organization) and private sector (e.g., the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and pharmaceutical industry partners).

Job Requirements

The Program Analyst (PA) will be an essential member of RTU and provide support to the team, performing a variety of both complex and routine administrative and technical duties.

The PA provides support to technical or managerial staff, performing routine administrative and analytical duties. These duties range from tasks such as scheduling briefings and meetings and maintaining program files to more complex analytical tasks such as collecting, compiling and analyzing data for various program documents and designing and maintaining spreadsheets in support of financial tracking systems. The PA works closely with the assigned team and provides input on related technical issues. The PA also works with other members of the team (and potentially across other parts of the Office or the Bureau) to assist in areas within the purview of RTU; assignments may include country backstopping, overall administrative support and other duties as assigned.

The PA ranks tasks in order of importance and impending deadlines and handles several tasks simultaneously. The individual is expected to become familiar with technical issues and policies pertaining to PRH and RTU

and must develop a working knowledge of applicable USAID policies and guidelines, as well as corporate practices and procedures. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

At the GS-11 equivalent level, PA time will be split between programmatic or technical tasks (approximately 70-80%) and administrative tasks (approximately 20-30%).

Responsibilities

Support technical, programmatic, and administrative engagement of PRH funded international/multilateral grants including coordinating communication, developing workplan priorities, developing technical and program documents and annual reports, and compiling and presenting financial documentation.

Support the programmatic management of RTU projects including the Expanding Effective Contraceptive Options project, Direct to Consumer Project, Direct to Consumer Ylabs and Passages projects.

Review, discuss, and consult with Technical Advisors and AOR/CORs regarding the approval of work plans, budgets, protocols,

and activities;

Support Technical Advisors and AOR/CORs in providing recommendations and technical input regarding project management and implementation; Assist AOR/COR and Technical Advisors in compiling appropriate financial documentation to ensure timely award and sub-award approvals, budget obligations, and agreement/contract modifications; Assist technical staff in the preparation of various program documents and correspondence such as project authorization documents, action memos, and waivers, ensuring that all documentation is complete and in compliance with USAID rules, regulations, and standards; Compile and analyze programmatic, technical, and budgetary data for the team’s project(s) and activities, and organize data for use in briefings, publications, reports, and decision making; and Support the formulation and implementation of program budgets, including Office and Agency budgeting exercises.

Support RTU and PRH technical and programmatic priorities

including assist in development of technical and program documents, such as annual reports, interagency documents, action memos, talking points, Congressional Notifications, and technical PowerPoint presentations; Assist technical staff in supporting field as necessary; travel to USAID missions as necessary; track, oversee, coordinate, and report on field support (may include technical responses to emails and phone calls); Coordinate, organize, and liaise with members of working groups, missions, and other USG agencies in support of program implementation, and attend working groups to advance USAID program objectives; and Assist in development, review, and analysis of program technical updates.

Support RTU quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis as needed including assist with the development of team presentations including synthesized analysis products using Excel, Google sheets, Panorama and/or other statistical software; Research, plan, analyze, and organize technical and/or statistical information, and develop data for use in briefings, publications, and reports; and Draft clear and succinct written summaries and/or Google or PowerPoint slide decks to help visualize data.

Execute administrative tasks including schedule team meetings and events; Support team with general logistics/support; maintain team calendar, call lines, meeting setup and logistics; Provide administrative support for hiring actions, onboarding of new staff, meetings logistics, Front Office taskers, and

memos, as needed; and Document minutes/notes of regular division and/or branch meetings, or other partner meetings, as required.

Professional Development:

Participate in professional continuing education, skills training, and professional meetings to enhance relevant technical skills and career development.

Complete and execute an Individual Learning and Training Plan and Annual Work Plan.



Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of Master’s degree and 3 years’ experience or Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of relevant experience.
  • At least 3 years of professional experience with one or two public health technical disciplines such as (Family Planning and Reproductive Health, HIV, etc); job duties/responsibilities generally related to PD requirements.
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Experience in project administration and management procedures
  • Some knowledge of USAID rules, regulations and capacity building concepts is a plus
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from team members, managers, and others
  • Strong quantitative and analysis skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft suite of programs (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form
  • International travel, ranging from 5-15%
  • US citizenship or US Permanent Residency with the ability to obtain and maintain Facility Access required

Preferred

Qualifications

  • Knowledge and experience with mixed method research and evaluation
  • Knowledge of pharmaceutical regulatory processes

  • Experience with health guideline development and dissemination

title: Alpha Consulting Corp.
description:
SOFTWARE QUALITY ASSURANCE ANALYST
PHILADELPHIA, PA

Must be fluent Speaking and Writing Spanish
Project Description:
  • Work with Subject Matter Experts, Project Managers and other Project Team Members to gather system requirements and any other pertinent documentation necessary to conduct SQA activities. Review and analyze System Requirements Specifications for completeness, consistency, and clarity.
  • Design and deliver comprehensive Test Plans to outline Test Strategy, Test Objectives, and Software Test Estimation to reflect the Resources (manpower, software, and hardware) required to complete the Test, Test Schedule, and Test Deliverables.
  • Design and develop Test Cases and Test Scripts for the System, Integration, Regression, Acceptance and Performance testing.
  • Prepare, analyze and maintain Test Data; execute Test Scripts and perform other required Verification and Validation Activities in accordance with the Test Plan; conduct Ad hoc and Exploratory testing, when applicable. Document test execution results.
  • Identify, log and manage Project Issues and Software Defects; conduct Defects Reviews with Software Developers, Subject Matter Experts, Project Managers and other members of the Project Team to monitor Defects resolution and disposal. Prepare Defects Summary reports to reflect the total number of reported defects, status of defects (open, closed, rejected. etc.), and the number of defects in different statuses ordered by the defects severity and priority.
  • Prepare comprehensive Test Status Reports that include Requirements Traceability Matrix, a summary of performed test activities, and the final test results.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the Software Development Lifecycle. Design, track and collect metrics to monitor project and product quality. Ensure the delivered products meet Customer's expectations.
  • Make recommendations to improve quality of products, processes and services.
  • Perform other duties and activities as specified by the Quality Assurance Manager.

Required Skills:
  • Must be fluent Speaking and Writing Spanish

This 6+ month position starts ASAP.

title: SchoolsFirst Federal Credit Union
description:
Position Summary

Provide quality control prior to User Acceptance testing to ensure quality software solutions are delivered and thorough testing is conducted throughout all phases of development life cycle. Evaluate current Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process in order to recommend enhancements and improvements, taking into consideration all the associated aspects of software testing, analysis and post-process maintenance.

Essential Job Functions

      • Collaborate with software development teams and other product owners to understand software requirements and ensure the development and test scenarios for all the new software solutions meet Software Development Life Cycle quality assurance standards.

      • Participates in the development and implementation of efficient and effective quality assurance methodology, including test automation, processes, procedures, templates, guidelines, and tools.

      • Form and maintain open communication and close collaboration between the Software Development team and Software Quality Assurance Testing team. Facilitates QA meetings and communicates test progress status/results, and other relevant information to project stakeholders and management. Determines when testing can proceed to final User Acceptance Testing and has direct responsibility for coordinating and managing code releases to various environments.

      • Preform audits and technical reviews of functional specifications and design documents to ensure the process is being followed. Use internal defect tracking and test case management system(s) to document test cases, record defects, record test case execution results and generate tracking reports for management. Identify issues during the development of a product (or delivery of a service) before it is released.

      • Communicate, prioritize and track test execution, defects and issues appropriately and recommend corrective action when needed.

      • Responsible in understanding other project timelines and the impact of the release schedules. Manage release issues and risks effectively and provide standards in process improvements.

      • Conduct manual testing of applications, reports, ETL, and other software solutions. Investigate and verify end-user reported defects.

      • Participates in definition of test conditions and scenarios and contributes in developing accurate and complete test plans. Develop and perform regression testing for critical applications to ensure existing functionalities are still working after the new fix / enhancement is introduced to production.

      • Provides testing support for new systems by learning the current department's business processes and understanding how these processes will run in the new system.

      • Serves as an advocate of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) best practices, methods, and processes.

      • Remains knowledgeable of new and emerging technology by researching technical materials, attending seminars and training classes, and consulting with personnel from other industries.

      • Performs other duties as assigned.

      • All teammembers must comply with regulatory compliance and assigned training requirements including but not limited to BSA regulations corresponding to their specific job duties. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary and other employment related actions.

Education/Years of Experience/Certifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics or related technical field or equivalent years of experience.

3-5 years related experience

.NET/C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET

Team Foundation Server

JavaScript

HTML 5.0

SQL Server/TSQL

Agile Methodology, SCRUM

Java

XML

Web Services

Software security scans (specifically Veracode)

Our client is looking for a Sr. SAS Programmer Analyst (w/ Migration)

  • Support migration and remediation of JReview objects

  • Good understanding of system development life cycles, GCP, and related regulatory guidelines.
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Able to work independently and a team player, good organizational and time management skills.
  • Excellent communication skills & capable of communicating technical concepts
  • Excellent organizational skills, demonstrated success to multi-task and deliver viable solutions in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
  • Experienced in writing complex macros and generic programs and related experience.

title: Synerfac Technical Staffing
description:
Software Quality Assurance Analyst
Allentown, PA or Sarasota, FL

We are seeking a talented individual to join our team as a QA Analyst. This is a full-time position reporting directly to the QA Manager.

As our QA Analyst you will be responsible for providing Quality Assurance testing for all company applications working closely with business and technology to review business requirements and develop a corresponding test plan. Your strong interpersonal and collaborative skills will be vital in working closely with business and technology resources to understand the requirements; and use the Business Requirements Document (BRD) to execute a test plan on the administration application suite.

Primary Responsibilities:
* Create and maintain test plan documentation.
* Set up and maintain test environments.
* Execute test conditions according to documented test plans.
* Validation of test results, test defect triage and research.
* Client User Acceptance (UAT) Support
* Production Support.
* Coordinate cross functionally with various departments to understand business requirements and ensuring releases are accurate and on time.

* Knowledge of standard quality assurance procedures and workflows
* Familiar with general Software Development Life (SDLC) principles and practices

• Contributes to and embraces project management, change management, Software Development Life Cycle, code management, and Company's established best practices.

title: Sierra Cybernetics
description:
Sierra Cybernetics is seeking a Programmer Analystwith User Interface (UI) and Interaction Design Programming experience to work for us at our government client’s site in downtown Los Angeles.

 

You will design and developthe user interfaces for all of our client's web, mobile, and desktop applications. You will provide expertise and development skills in creating graphical user interfaces which facilitate service presentation and delivery to the client's customers and comply with existing and future technical accessibility requirements.The applications that our client's staff, customers and the general public interact with via web and mobile applications need to deliver information as simply, effectively and quickly as possible. The screen designs must be easily navigable, comprehendible, and user friendly in order to properly and rapidly communicate with the end user.

 

This assignment is expected to last up to 12 months.

 

Your duties will include, but are not be limited to, the following:

•        Provide technical expertise and application development assistance in the design, development, testing and implementation of new user interfaces for existing and future client applications.

•        Perform as project lead for UI/UX development

•        Oversee and have hands-on development of user interfaces and their development lifecycle

•        Create presentations and wireframes, prototypes, or mockups

•        Provide updates on project status and any problems encountered

•        Develop the application in accordance with accepted client and industry standards

•        Ensure the application interface and design is in compliance with ADA Section 508 regulations

•        Follow the instructions of our client's staff

•        Document the interface and its use, as needed

•        Develop training materials and train our client's staff to maintain the application interfaces

 

You must have 5+ years of experience in the following:

•        User interface and user experience design

•        Layout and design of web and mobile user interfaces

•        Wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups

•        Designing and developing user interfaces from application specification and requirements documents

•        Utilizing wireframing, prototyping, mockup tools - Justinmind, Axure, Balsamiq, InVision, Mocqups, Photoshop, Illustrator

•        Knowledge of user design principles

•        ADA accessibility and compliance, Section 508

•        Mobile user design interface development for iOS and Android

•        Information security standards

•        Software development best practices

•        Extensive hands-on experience with HTMLS and CSS

•        Strong analysis and design skills

•        Ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities in an effective and timely manner

•        Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, and training skills

•        Ability to work independently and in a team environment

•        Experience working respectfully in a culturally diverse work environment

title: Sterling Bank & Trust
description:
Sterling is a full service bank with $3.2 billion in assets. Sterling was recognized as the “Top Performing Community Bank in the United States” in 2017 and 2018 by S&P Global Market Intelligence. Sterling has experienced consistent growth over the last 8 years and is now a bi-coastal bank that operates in four of the United States’ biggest metropolitan areas.

 

Sterling currently has an immediate opening for a Programmer Analyst located in Southfield, Michigan.

 

The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, developing and testing computer programs. Evaluates user requests for new or modified computer programs to determine feasibility, cost and time required, Also determines compatibility with current system, and computer capabilities. Consults with users to identify current operating procedures and clarify program objectives.

A.) from four-year college or university; and three years related experience with iSeries, AS/400, programming in RPG/400, RPG III, RPG IV, RPG ILE, RPG FREE, SDA, SEU, PDM, CLP, SQL & RDI. Knowledge of HTML, Java Script, PHP and other programming languages may be helpful. Previous bank programming experience preferred.

 

The computer programmer has to have excellent technical skills and knowledge, ability to work well with others. They are expected to work both independently and as part of a team.

 

Are you…

Then Sterling Bank & Trust is the place for you! We are looking to add talented team members who desire to be on a winning team with opportunities for career advancement

title: Aleknagik Technology, LLC
description:
JOB DEFINITION: Provide expert level services to customize, maintain, and deploy enterprise level SharePoint and ASP.NET solutions. Design, develop, maintain, and modernize database driven web applications. Candidate will be assigned design, architecture, and programming tasks. Tasks must be evaluated and a level of effort and completion date provided. Must be able to plan for and implement new technologies as they become available in the IT environment. Communicate effectively with management, team members, and customers. Attention to detail, customer service oriented, and creative problem-solving capabilities required. Respond quickly and effectively to task requests that require a very short turn-around. Maintain current skill set to grow with emerging technologies used in business automation solutions.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The following duties ARE NOT intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification. Shown are duties intended to provide a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may not be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional, position-specific duties.

 

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES:

 

Technical Requirements:

  • Web application development, deployment, and maintenance experience using Visual Studio 2010, ASP.NET, C#, Visual Basic .NET, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and AJAX.
  • Database design and reporting services experience using Oracle, SQL Server, and SQL Server Reporting Services. Experience using SQL Server Management Studio and TOAD or SQL Developer.
  • Experience with the use of source control systems, primarily Team Foundation Server.
  • Configuration and development for the Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007/2010 platform and the Microsoft Office System.
  • Knowledge in the use of InfoPath for creating custom forms containing managed code and using data connections.
  • Design, build, and deploy custom web parts, working with SharePoint templates, and creating custom SharePoint workflows.
  • Development, deployment, and consumption of web services.
  • Creation of process flowcharts, technical documentation, and other system documentation.

Analysis, Architecture, and Consultation:

  • Ability to analyze business processes and gather/document software requirements.
  • Familiarity with the use of Agile methodologies to plan and manage software projects.
  • Experience creating software design and architecture documentation. Expert level technical skills and experience developing high-level conceptual models of business processes and defining solutions based on organization and business requirements.
  • Established ability to reengineer existing business processes to achieve maximum automation efficiency.
  • Experience consulting end-users in the use of SharePoint and the Microsoft Office System as a collaboration and document management system.
  • Recommend and implement architecture and design improvements.
  • Perform design, code, and database design reviews to ensure compliance with established coding and database design standards.

Performs other duties as assigned or required.

 

KNOWLEDGE and SKILLS:

 

  • The candidate must have experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and working with websites developed in Visual Studio 2010. Experience with ASP.NET, Classic ASP, Visual Basic .NET, C#, Oracle, SQL Server, and Microsoft Access is highly preferred.
  • Experience with SharePoint 2007/2010, setup and configuration of SharePoint sites, and the ability to consult end-users in the use of SharePoint as a collaboration and document management system is required.
  • Ability to work in a team environment as well as be self-directed.
  • Ability and willingness to take direction from senior level software developers and engineers.
  • Perform software training and develop system documentation.
  • Ability to reinvent business processes to prepare them for automation.
  • Attention to detail, customer service oriented, and creative problem-solving capabilities is mandatory.
  • Respond quickly and effectively to task requests that require a very short turn-around.
  • Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
  • Highly self-motivated and directed.
  • Keen attention to detail.
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
  • Strong customer service orientation.
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Self-motivated to learn, troubleshoot, and complete projects.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent AND five (5) years of progressively complex information technology and/or application programming experience; OR equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Experience must include significant work with application programming.

 

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Required to work outside the traditional work schedule. Maybe called out to work off-shift for on-call or emergency situations.  An Interim Secret Clearance is required prior to confirmed full time employment.

 

MINIMUM PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The following demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This position requires persistent repetitive movements of the hands, wrists and fingers and the ability to sit for long periods of time.

title: Capstone Corporation
description:
Overview

Capstone is seeking a SharePoint Analyst/Web Developer to join our team to specialize in designing and maintaining solutions for applications supporting the Office of the Chief of Naval Operations and selected components of the Secretary of the Navy. This position will focus on customizing our client's SharePoint applications and supporting the content management of those sites. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated with a passion for growing their technical skill sets.

 

The project is located on-site in Arlington, VA at The Pentagon.

 

Responsibilities

  • Provides support, consultation, and guidance to meet customer's overall objectives.
  • Defines, plans and implements SharePoint business collaboration solutions.
  • Analyzes business requirements, and designs and configures technology solutions to improve business process efficiency and effectiveness.

  • Manages /maintains enterprise-wide publishing as well as team collaboration sites.
  • Configures/maintains workflow collaboration services.
  • Stays current on Office 365 technologies and recommends/implements modern collaboration tools where applicable including but not limited to Teams, Planner, Power Apps and Flow.
  • Integrates Business Intelligence features into collaboration solutions where applicable.
  • Develops and maintains positive, cooperative and team-oriented relationships. 

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree.
  • Two (2) years’ experience in an IT related field.

Minimum qualification:.

  • Experience with SharePoint.
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Office Suite.
  • Interpersonal skills required in order to interact effectively with staff and all levels of management in identifying and resolving issues and dealing with sensitive problems and situation.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Effective organizational and time management skills.

Minimum clearance:

  • Secret clearance.

title: ePlus inc.
description:
ePlus inc. is currently seeking a Software Test Analyst for our client in Richmond, VA.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
  • Responsible for software test analysis to support manual and stress testing.
  • Support testing needs for new and legacy system integration needs.
  • Work alongside software developers, business analysts, product owners and other system specialists to gather and interpret user/system requirements.
  • Produce well-structured, documented and maintainable test scripts for manual testing that support the software test cycle within the SDLC.
  • Participate in the development and support of the testing program aimed at supporting multiple testing efforts simultaneously.
  • Create clearly documented defect reports for anomalies found during test procedures.
  • Validate that user expectations are achieved during the testing process.
  • Develop and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for new applications, and/or enhancements to existing applications throughout their development/product lifecycles.

 


QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  • Experience with front-end, UI and back-end validation testing.
  • Thorough understanding of various browsers user agents and compatibility testing.
  • Knowledge of SQL and database interaction.
  • Knowledge of automation testing frameworks.
  • Strong analytical skills; attention to details.
  • SDemonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a software development team.
  • Basic understanding of Java or other object-oriented programming languages.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
  • Ability to write test plans and test scripts
  • Experience with PL/SQL
  • Experience with JMeter, Load Runner, or other stress testing applications
  • Experience testing web and client server applications
  • Experience with heavy integration testing
  • Experience with automation frameworks


PREFERRED:
 
  • Experience working in an Agile or iterative development environment.
  • Knowledge of test automation and best practices.
  • Experience with Jira, or another similar system (TFS, VersionOne, etc).
  • Experience testing e-commerce, mobile, web, POS (Point-of-sale), financial and human resource applications preferred.
  • A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Information Systems is preferred. Extensive current experience in software testing is required.

title: Autoliv ASP, Inc.
description:
Autoliv ASP, Inc. has an opening for the position of Application Architect/Analyst/Programmer (Ref# AA62OD).

Work Location:  3350 Airport Rd. Ogden, UT 84405.  Position requires up to 50% domestic & international travel.

Job Duties:  Responsible for development, customization, implementation, and maintenance of software solutions including all facets of functionality in the Oracle JD Edwards (JDE) system modules, including Development, Distribution Management, Financial Management, Inventory Management, Procurement Management, Manufacturing Management, Requirements Planning, Customer Relationship Management, Sales Order Management, Supply Chain Execution (Logistics), Transportation Management, Customs Compliance, and Localization.  Develop new applications in JDE.  Responsible for the implementation of the Design & Order solution for Autoliv machine build plants, which integrates Autoliv Specific Systems with the JD Edwards ERP system in order to maintain the entire machine build flow.  Perform analysis of the business processes and requirements relating to the JDE system modules.  Troubleshoot system issues such as configuration, data cleanliness, code problems, user interface, poor performance, and security.  Support migration to new versions of JDE, including retrofitting custom code.  Configure applications in JDE to meet business requirements.  Setup OCM (Object Configuration Manager) mappings as needed to configure data sources per the environment.  Create and maintain interfaces between JDE and 3rd party applications.  Provide technical analysis and problem resolution to support requests received from system users located in various Autoliv locations in US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Indonesia, and Korea.  Support JDE Localization module requirements for Mexico and Brazil, while ensuring compatibility with standardized business processes of the JDE environment.  Evaluate needed changes in current systems running and make adjustments to the software as needed.  Perform Z-File and UBE (Universal Batch Engine) processing.  Create and maintain existing Crystal Reports using report development tools.  Understand “Order to Cash” and “Procure to Pay” business processes to support software development creation and integration.  Maintain other custom in-house Autoliv applications.  Use of Oracle JD Edwards (JDE), JDE UPK (User Productivity Kit), Oracle BI Publisher, .NET Framework, C#, ASP.Net, VB.Net, Visual Studio, Web Services, WPF, HTML, CSS, jQuery, JavaScript, Crystal Reports, AS/400, and SQL Server.

Requirements:  This position requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign academic equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.  Plus 7 years of experience in the job offered or 7 years in a related occupation including Oracle JDE Consultant or related experience.  Will accept an Associate’s degree or 2 years of post-secondary education plus 9 years of experience in lieu of the required education and experience.  Position requires 5 years of experience with business processes analysis and the following Oracle JD Edwards modules:  Development, Distribution Management, Financial Management, Inventory Management, Procurement Management, Customer Relationship Management, Sales Order Management, Supply Chain Execution (Logistics), Customs Compliance, and Localization.  Will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience as per the requirements cited herein.  40hrs/week.

Application Instructions:  To apply, please MAIL resume to the address below, ensuring to indicate the position reference code (Ref# AA62OD) for which you are applying.  Mail to:  Autoliv ASP, Inc., Attn:  T. Clark - PHR, Human Resource Manager, 3350 Airport Road, Ogden, UT  84405.

title: Collin County - Government
description:
Job Description

Interested candidates must apply on the Collin County Human Resources Career website: https://www.collincountytx.gov/human_resources/pages/careers.aspx

The System Analyst/programmer is responsible for the development, maintenance and support of small, medium and progressively more complex applications for the enterprise delivered via the web, Internet and Intranet and/or client-server. The incumbent is responsible for applying .NET best practices, architectures, and patterns, assists other developers in programming, and aids in planning, architecting, securing, unit testing, and deploying applications. Responsible for adhering to Agile Principles, change control policies, and service level agreement (SLA) compliance. Keeps current on legal and technical issues that affect the County.

Essential Functions:

  • Communicates with end-users and third-party vendors to obtain requirements for projects and application updates for all applications
  • Participates in the design, programming (development), maintenance and execution of testing of new and changed functionality for medium to complex applications
  • Writes programs for specific applications and designs special reports and forms as requested by various County departments in compliance with County and IT department policy and procedures
  • Updates system end-user and training documentation
  • Leads the effort of actively collaborating with business units to identify improvements that will increase efficiency of the systems
  • Provides second-level end-user support of our enterprise applications including PeopleSoft, Odyssey and Munis
  • Assists with statistical reporting to management relating to application performance, usability and upgrade requirements to properly support County departments
  • Manages interfaces and associate error troubleshooting
  • Maintains business process procedures in conjunction with the process owners
  • Resolves Request/Incident tickets from users and provides telephone and onsite technical support to troubleshoot and fix the most complex customer department end-user problems
  • Creates Request/Incident tickets from users and generates Requests for Change to the production environment to troubleshoot and fix the most complex customer department end-user problems
  • Works closely with vendors to resolve issues and manage deployments
  • Analyzes and resolves the most complex application and data problems
  • Performs other related duties as assigned

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. Two (2) years of experience in information technology including experience or training in systems analysis, design and computer programming. Current relevant experience with Mobile Application development tools, Visual Studio, OLAP, ODBC; .NET programming languages, Python, C#, AJAX along with HTML, CSS, XML, XSLT, and JavaScript; UML; and SharePoint, TFS, SQL Server and other contemporary programming languages preferred. Must have at least 2 years’ experience with the PeopleSoft Integrated Development Environment – PeopleSoft Application Designer, PeopleCode, PeopleSoft Application Engine. PeopleSoft pages and interfaces, Fluid UX.  Collin County IT Applications practices Agile methodologies.  Candidates must have 3 years’ experience working in an Agile environment (Sprints, Stand-ups, Planning, Retrospectives, Scrum and Kanban). Must have 2 years’ experience gather and working with business requirements.

Workplace and Benefits

Collin County offesr a fast-paced working environment, tuition reimbursement, and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and long and short term disability. Retirement benefits have an excellent employer match. 

You must submit a completed application to be considered for employment. Attaching a resume is not considered an acceptable substitute for a completed application.

Compensation 

Starting Salary: $64,770 per year

title: Franklin Energy
description:
Description
Position at Franklin Energy

Position Summary

We provide our utility clients with a wide range of energy-saving and renewable energy solutions. From individual utility customers and construction contractors, to utilities, municipalities, and government bodies, our clients have come to depend on our customized energy efficiency programs to help them to meet their energy saving goals.

The Senior Programmer/Analyst is primarily responsible for providing technical support and development for the company’s data management systems. This position requires the incumbent to provide leadership and support in the design and implementation of the database structure, queries, transforms, integrations and reports to support the needs as directed by the Business Architect. Has knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within energy efficiency programs, and advanced technical aptitude in a multitude of technologies. You will also be working with others who are passionate about energy efficiency and making a positive impact on the industry.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

This list of duties and responsibilities is not all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as management may deem necessary from time to time.

  • Provide development, oversight, and management of custom .Net applications
  • Work with central support and operations teams to provide technical solutions to solve application and business needs
  • Provide technical leadership and support and be a strong collaborator with subject matter experts, project managers, and developer team members.
  • Apply in-depth technical knowledge to develop applications across one or more technology areas, such as web applications, APIs (e.g., REST and SOAP), web services and application database integrations.
  • Plan, design, develop, test, debug, and deploy enterprise applications.
  • Document key SDLC processes by producing formal documents like solution architecture documents and technical system design specifications, etc.
  • Participate in troubleshooting complex issues and resolving defects.
  • Coach / mentor junior developers, contractors, or interns to help grow the team’s overall skill-base and elevate team effectiveness.
  • Follow all company policies and procedures.

Position Requirements
