title: Apex Systems
description:
Apex Systems has an immediate opening for a Sr. Software Asset Manager

Location: Washington, DC

If interested, please send your resume to Christine Kunz at ckunz@apexsystems.com

Overview: The Software Asset Management (SAM) Analyst will support SAM processes for a government customer. This position will require the development and implementation of policies, processes, and actions that identify, track, and provide overall software license management to support the customer’s software assets across the enterprise.  It also requires education and/or experience in software program management via licensing to include enterprise agreements, quantity-based purchasing, and license quantity/cost reduction. The SAM Analyst will need to be familiar with agile and waterfall methodology to implement an automated tool for the customer to more accurately inventory, install, purchase, and update software in a repeatable process.

EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalence in Computer Science, Information Systems/Technology or Engineering.
  • 5 years job experience 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Engage with stakeholders and build consensus on project success criteria.
  • Work with Team Lead to ensure timely prioritization of project commitments.
  • Create and maintain status reporting via Power Point/ Excel / customer Specific Tools.
  • Provide technical and administrative assistance to assure the assets, products and services purchased and installed conform to service level agreements, contract specifications, agreed upon schedule and the expected level of quantity and quality.
  • Support to the Government Software team.
  • Provide support services ranging from user assistance, software installs, purchase assistance, renewals, removals, entitlement and proof of purchase tracking, network scan reconciliation, download assistance, procurement package documentation.
  •  Coordinate oversight of software asset inventory and reporting needs.
  • Assist with the review, process, and tracking of all software licensing, and maintenance requests from initial submission to delivery.
  • Collect and maintain accurate Software Licensing information in repositories to address budgeting, software compliance & inventory, contracts, cost and internal and external audit queries
  • Implement SAM solution tools, processes and procedures to automate the collection, storage and reporting of key software data so that the products can be managed across the enterprise in an effective manner.
  • Continuously assesses tool capabilities for software discover, inventory, and meter software use for key vendor products.
  • Provide analysis of the software data that can be used to drive key business decisions.
  • Track and ensure notice periods are met for changes and cancellations. Identify savings opportunities.
  • Respond to requests from Software Owners, end users, managers, developers, and team members for specific IT Software Asset Management information.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  •  

 REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • Complete understanding of software lifecycle management
  • Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving skills, including the ability to accumulate, organize, and assimilate large amounts of information.
  • Knowledge of Software Asset Management principals / practices
  • Understanding of Asset Management tools and technologies
  • Strong Excel and PDF skills
  • Knowledge of product use rights for publishers such as VMware, Microsoft, Oracle, Adobe, etc.
  • Strong written & verbal communication skills
  • Strong cross-functional team skills
  • Ability to multitask
  • Understanding of Waterfall and Agile Project Management methodologies

Candidates must be U.S. citizens and be able to obtain and/or maintain a Department of Defense Secret security clearance as a condition of employment

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystemsinc.com or 844-463-6178.

title: CHRISTUS Health
description:
Description

The Epic Systems Analyst serves as a liaison between end-users, project team members, and other Information Management resources while providing exemplary customer service and Epic application support in assigned Epic module. They provides onsite go-live support, upgrade support, and ongoing application support and optimization. In addition, they work closely with the Service Desk to assist in responding to help desk tickets and end user requests through analyzing business issues/requirements, analyzing workflows, and synthesizing key messages. The EPIC Systems Analyst must be a self-motivated individual with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in team environments.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop, test, implement, support, and maintain Epic assigned applications, solutions and business processes to meet operational and technical requirements
  • Obtain and maintain in-depth knowledge of software functionality; acquire and utilize knowledge of operational workflows to be implemented
  • Perform in-depth analysis of workflows, data collection, report details, and other technical issues associated with Epic software
  • Translate business requirements into functional specifications and manages changes to specifications
  • Prioritize, coordinate, and implement updates and requested changes to the system; reviews and tests each new release; troubleshoots problems and questions from end users
  • Adhere to organization standards for system configuration and change control
  • Develop strong relationships with end user communities, customers and business partners
  • Facilitate communication with stakeholders from initial requirements to final implementation
  • Serves as a liaison between business operations and providers, internal information technology, system users and Epic, working within the defined project objectives for issue and problem resolution
  • Troubleshoot and/or resolve application issues and escalate more complex issues as appropriate


Requirements

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

Education/Skills

  • Ability to present complex data in meaningful method, ie., charges, graphs
  • Ability to adjust to and implement change
  • Problem Solving skills
  • Multitasking skills
  • Work as a team member
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Highly effective written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills to establish working relationships that foster optimal quality teamwork and education
  • Strong organizational skills in managing multiple priorities

Experience

To determine "Years of Experience":

  • Epic application work - 1 year = 100%
  • Non-Epic IM application work -- 1 year = 50%
  • Operational work congruent with module to be supported -- 1 year = 25%

Examples:

  • Epic Clin Doc Analyst (certified or proficient) who previously worked as an analyst at another facility for the past 2 years. Prior to his analyst role, he worked as an RN in acute care for 2 years.
                     a. Years of experience: 2.5
  • IM associate has supported a non-Epic application for the past 4 years. Prior to moving to IM, she worked in Bed Planning for 2 years.
                      a. Years of experience: 2.5

Must meet all criteria

  • Certified or proficient in more than one Epic modules [preferred* change to required going forward]
  • 5+ years of experience
  • Solves complex incidents without direction
  • Develops new functionality for requests without direction and leads multidisciplinary teams throughout project
  • Serves as mentor or knowledge resource to peers across Epic community and is viewed as a leader
  • Recommendation and approval by Director or above

Licenses, Registrations, or Certifications

  • Associates or Bachelor's Degree, preferred
  • Application certification in assigned module, preferred
  • Required to obtain certification/proficiency from vendor within 6 months of hire if hired without certification/proficiency
  • LVN, RN or other clinical License may be required for clinical application teams

title: Kratos Defense & Security Solutions
description:
Job Description

Kratos is a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment that is team oriented and relationship driven to foster innovation and creativity within the space industry. Our motto "From Strength to Success" reflects a commitment to continually leveraging our technical and intellectual strengths for the ultimate success of our customers. The Federal Solutions Group is a leader in satellite command and control solutions focused on DoD, Civil (NOAA/NASA), and classified customers. We are an agile and innovative solutions provider in that we integrate Kratos-developed products with 3rd party software, as well as design and develop new tools and applications to provide end-to-end systems that solve mission unique requirements.

Kratos is seeking a Pricing Analyst.  This person must have experience submitting Cost Volumes for Department of Defense Acquisitions.  Knowledge of the FAR is required, along with a history of responding to RFPs is required.  Pricing activities will include all types of contracts, T&M, Cost Plus, Firm Fixed Price.

The qualified candidate will:

Contribute to the development of project accounting from beginning of contract to the completion of the project. 

Will understand the planning aspect of a project and ability to track elements of cost from planning to revenue recognition and have the ability to review an understand contract modifications and implications to the program based on contractual language.

Contribute to the proposal pricing process including the understanding of a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), contract types, and the integration of the Cost Volume Documents and Excel requirements on any given proposal. 

Will have the ability to understand an Request For Proposal (RFP) and contribute to the delivery of a compliant Cost Volume to both Government and Non-Government customers.  This portion of the job is often at the mercy of the proposal schedule, requiring hours worked in excess of normal business hours, on an as needed basis.

Enter data into Pro-Pricer, then produce data in Excel to support Cost Volumes.  Each RFP will be unique, therefore creativity between Pro-Pricer and Excel will be required to satisfy excel versions of the cost proposal.

Experience and Skills

-Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or related field; equivalent experience may be considered.

-Project Management Professional (PMP) desired.

-Minimum of 10 years experience within the Defense Industry.

-Experience working with DCMA and DCAA.

-Experience with Pro-Pricer software a plus.

-This position may have EVMS duties as well.  Participation in on a Finance Team developing monthly CPR deliverables is desirable.

-Experience with Deltek Cobra a plus.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills, use of Microsoft Software.

-Position located in Colorado Springs, CO.

U.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government Security Clearance is required.
Kratos offers challenging work, an excellent environment, & great benefits! Kratos is an affirmative action / equal opportunity employer that recognizes the importance of diversity. We are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment and strongly encourage minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. Please, no phone calls, agencies or recruiters.

title: Federated Hermes, Inc.
description:
For more than 60 years, Federated Hermes has provided world-class investment solutions to financial professionals in the United States and around the world. Federated Hermes' employees have defined the qualities of the company’s success over the decades: a reputation for integrity and excellence, a commitment to customers and employees and a history of longstanding client relationships. While each market cycle brings new opportunities and challenges to the company, Federated Hermes continues to foster employee commitment to excellence in the investment management industry.

 

CAREER OPPORTUNITY #: 7974
POSITION TITLE: INTERMEDIATE BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
DEPARTMENT: BISD-IMBS INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS

 

POSITION SPECIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Business, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience required
  • 3+ years of business or systems analysis experience required
  • Experience working with MS Windows based applications required
  • Experience modifying or writing Structured Query Language (SQL) preferred
  • Experience on team-oriented systems projects preferred
  • Experience in financial services or securities industry with knowledge of investment products preferred

  

MAJOR DUTIES:

  • Solve business problems by performing business analysis, preparing requirements specifications, and testing for relevant business process modifications, applications, and/or reporting enhancements
  • Work collaboratively with the business unit (Investment Management Operations) to define business requirements and provide consultative support as needed regarding applications and business work flows
  • Evaluate business needs, in collaboration with the team, and recommend potential solutions, including integration and interfacing with existing systems or third-party vendors
  • Work with technical and development staff to conduct unit, system, and user acceptance testing. This includes developing and publishing test specifications, preparing test data, and creating user acceptance testing documents
  • Determine and prepare estimates for completion of assigned tasks
  • Prepare business and functional requirements documents and all other required documentation as outlined in Federated's Software Development Lifecycle Process
  • Provide hands-on support and training, as needed, to business users

   

HOURS/LOCATION:

  • 8:30 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. (over time as required)
  • Federated Investors Tower – Pittsburgh, PA 15222

 

EXPLANATORY COMMENTS:

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong decision making and problem solving skills
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Well organized with the ability to work independently and as a member of a team

 

Federated Hermes, Inc. offers a competitive salary and benefits package along with a professional environment.

 

For consideration, go to https://careers.federatedinvestors.com/psp/PSEXT/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_APP_SCHJOB.GBL?Page=HRS_APP_JBPST&Action=U&FOCUS=Applicant&SiteId=11&JobOpeningId=7974&PostingSeq=1

 

Only those candidates in whom we have an interest will be contacted.
EOE

title: Randstad
description:
job summary:

Job Description


Randstad Technologies is current seeking a talented Data Analyst to join a well-known financial services organization in the greater DTLA area. This person will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. Assists the business in turning data into information, turning information into insight and insight into decisions.


Responsibilities


•Interprets data and analyzes results using statistical techniques and provides ongoing reports.
•Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
•Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintains databases/data systems.
•Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets.
•Filters and "cleans" data, and reviews computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
•Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
•Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities.

Competencies:


•Analysis: Identify and understand issues, problems and opportunities; compare data from different sources to draw conclusions.
•Communication: Clearly convey information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
•Exercising Judgment and Decision Making: Use effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; recommend or take action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and probable consequences.
•Technical and Professional Knowledge: Demonstrate a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; remains current with developments and trends in areas of expertise.
•Building Effective Relationships: Develop and use collaborative relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals.
•Client Focus: Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; develop and sustain productive client relationships.

Requirements


•9-12 years' experience - Financial Services experience highly preferred.
•Must have Informatica Power Center

•Including experience in: Data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.


•Reporting packages, databases (SQL, etc.), programming (JavaScript, ETL frameworks, etc.)
•Statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.)
•Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
•Minimum of a B.S. in Computer Science, MIS or related degree and two (2) to three (3) years of relevant experience or a combination of education, training and experience.

title: Open Systems Technologies
description:
Our client is seeking a Systems Analyst to join their team in Phoenix, AZ.

They are looking for a dynamic individual that will take the analysis lead in wide range of projects. The candidate will work with Project Managers, Developers, Business Analyst and key business leaders to develop and deploy solutions to meet complex business and system requirements. The System Analyst will work with industry leading systems and vendors as they support the rapidly changing customer demands for Client Customers.

Responsibilities

  • Analyzes designs and prepares functional specifications for information systems solutions which address business requirements
  • Great communicator with ability to summarize complex technical topics for all stakeholders and varying levels of the organization
  • Works closely with business teams to strategize solutions that support short and long term company objectives
  • Provides comprehensive consultation to business unit and IT management at the highest technical level through all phases of the system development lifecycle (SDLC)
  • Works closely with client and IT management and staff to identify: application development solutions, new applications or modifications to existing programs, capability to reuse existing code, integration of purchased solutions or a combination there of and the appropriate software development methodology alternatives
  • Responsible for facilitating business requirements gathering and translating into system requirements, when required
  • Review Business Requirements and work with and guide business partners to complete business requirements documentation
  • Clearly define systems work scope and objectives based on Business Requirements
  • Researches and evaluates alternative solutions and recommends the most efficient and cost effective approach
  • Translate Business Requirements into systems functional specifications and active participant in system design specifications
  • Provide systems expertise to system users, business partners, and other internal/external customers including trouble shooting issues, as well as, identifying and correcting inefficiencies
  • Provides input for test strategies and plans

Qualifications

Required

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline and at least six years of experience as a Business Analyst, Systems Analyst, Developer, or related field required
  • 5+ years of system analysis, business analysis or development experience includes writing system functional specifications
  • Ability to manage customer requirements and scope discussions
  • Ability to develop complex use cases to ensure quality solutions
  • Thorough understanding of the system development life cycle (SDLC)
  • Experience with Data Warehousing & Business Intelligence tools
  • Experience with HL7 interface specifications a plus
  • Must have ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks. Some independent judgment required in setting priorities of tasks among multiple assigned projects
  • Participate in technical design documents and solution overview documentation
  • Experience with Web design or wireframe experience
  • Experience with Data Warehousing & Business Intelligence tools
  • Experience with reviewing business requirements, system functional requirements and developing systems specifications

title: Morneau Shepell
description:
Benefits Analyst

Build a meaningful career

At Morneau Shepell, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives.  The extraordinary expertise of a more than 6,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.

Benefits Analyst

Administrative Solutions US

Norwood, MA

Permanent Full Time


Summary
A Senior Analyst provides support to Team Leads and client contacts by serving as a subject matter expert and as a technical systems resource for the benefit plans and employee populations of their assigned clients through the daily administration of processes, case management and project work. 

Responsibilities

  • Manage administrative and case management issues as well as data processing activities on a daily basis
  • Monitor project schedules to ensure timelines and deliverables are met; notify project manager or client if timelines are in jeopardy
  • Test and analyze system configuration against requirement documents during implementation and administration
  • Use our sophisticated database of tools to set up a client's healthcare & group benefits database; define data fields, import data, design screens and create queries and reports
  • Meet with project managers and clients to define project scope and objectives, prepare work plans, documenting project's scope and review with client(s)
     

Succeeding as a "Senior Analyst, Administrative Solutions" will require the following core qualifications and skills

  • BA/BS degree preferred
  • One to three years experience preferred or equivalent industry experience
  • CEBS coursework preferred
  • Experience in specific domains of HR administration (Benefits, Pension Plans and Healthcare & Group Benefits) is preferred
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel, and proficient in Access and Word
  • Experience with prior software implementation and training desired
  • Good analytical skills
  • Ability to work within a team environment
  • Strong self-starter, fast learner, quality conscious, committed to deadlines
  • Knowledge of SQL is a plus
  • Strong oral and written communication, attention to detail and teamwork skills combined with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Morneau Shepell is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to hire without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, sex, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation or veteran status.

Job Grade: MS3

 

Fulfilling work that matters

Morneau Shepell is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours. 

We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve.

We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.

Find your fit with us. Follow us on LinkedIn, Youtube and Twitter.

title: Midwest Tape, LLC
description:
About Midwest Tape:

Midwest Tape is a library-dedicated full-service media distributor providing physical and digital media to thousands of libraries across North America. We are strong believers in continually innovating to better serve our customers and deliver the best experience possible for the staff and patrons of public libraries. Our International Headquarters is located in Holland, Ohio at the facility that we built in 2016, to house our distribution center and support teams for Midwest Tape, hoopla digital, the fastest growing app serving libraries and Dreamscape Publishing, the Library-First publisher of Audiobooks and Video. As we build our team to support the ongoing growth of our business, we are looking for enthusiastic team players dedicated to delivering best-in-class service for our library customers and their patrons.

Position Summary:
The Salesforce Analyst is responsible for maintaining the Salesforce platform including managing and improving existing workflows, performing software updates, building reports, managing dashboards and managing security profiles for company Salesforce users.
The Salesforce Analyst will work with the Salesforce Administrator to ensure we are maximizing efficiency and capitalizing on the full features and benefits of Salesforce based on departmental and end user needs.

The Salesforce Analyst also serves as primary contact for Salesforce users, promoting adoption of new features and functionality, and providing user training as needed.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Daily administration and support of Salesforce user accounts, including but not limited to managing multiple user setup, profiles and roles.
2. Grant/ remove and maintain Salesforce user licenses.
3. Maintain and/or enhance customized Salesforce reports and dashboards.
4. Customization of Salesforce objects, database fields, record types, page layouts and data validations.
5. Develop process documentation and field maps related to Salesforce.
6. Communicate with users regarding new features, enhancements and changes to Salesforce.
7. Perform Salesforce software updates as needed
8. Document new Salesforce requirements and work with Salesforce Administrator to implement solutions.
9. Implement Salesforce changes with minimal user disruption.
10. Actively participate in the Salesforce testing process, including creation of test plans and test cases, establishing testing protocols and appropriate testing environments.
11. Keep abreast of new Salesforce features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvements.
12. Train new and existing users on how to use Salesforce features and functionality.
13. Provide technical support to Salesforce users.
14. Continually seek ways to enhance Salesforce end user experience.

Required skills:
• Salesforce configuration knowledge
• Experience creating Salesforce reports and dashboards
• A desire to continuously learn new Salesforce features
• Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
• Written skills to document new and existing business processes
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Analytical and reasoning abilities
• Process optimization experience
• Excellent organizational and multitasking skills
• Experience training others
• Team player with positive “can-do” attitude
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel
• Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team

Preferred Education Requirements:
• Bachelors’ Degree in Information Technology or related field.

Preferred Experience:
• 3 years of Salesforce usage and end user support
• Salesforce.com certification is ideal

Physical Requirements/Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics and physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• Ability to regularly remain in a stationary position for extended periods of time
• Ability to occasionally bend, twist, stoop, and crouch
• Ability to work on a computer for extended periods of time.
• Ability to regularly lift and/or move up to ten (10) pounds
• Ability to perform repetitive motion type tasks
• Ability to occasionally move about inside the office to perform job-related tasks
• Ability to frequently communicate with others

title: Trustco Bank
description:
Job Title: BSA Analyst I

Reports to: Vice President of BSA

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Salary Grade: NE12

Supervisory Responsibility: No



SUMMARY:



The BSA Analyst position is responsible for ensuring compliance with the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA)/Anti-Money Laundering (AML) policies and procedures and the applicable federal regulations to protect the company from being used as a conduit for illegal activity. The BSA/AML program includes currency transaction reports (CTR) Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR) Customer Identification Program (CIP) and Customer Due Diligence (CDD).



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned by supervisor and/or Trustco Bank’s Board of Directors.




  • Researches analyzes and investigates alerts generated by transaction monitoring reports for money laundering; BSA violations terrorist financing and other financial crimes then makes a recommendation as to whether or not a SAR should be completed.

  • Performs 90 days SAR follow up reviews; makes a recommendation as to whether or not a continuing activity SAR should be filed.

  • Tracks CTR filings based on monitoring reports and ensures CTRs are sent within the regulatory deadline of 15 days.

  • Monitors customers on the CTR exempt list on an annual basis.

  • Completes enhanced due diligence (EDD) reviews including research gathering documents drawing conclusions composing a narrative and determining the risk rating and follow up needed.

  • Monitors potential OFAC matches acts as a dual control for OFAC processing and provide a knowledgeable resource for staff of other departments.

  • Examines branch administration retail lending and commercial loans to ensure CIP requirements are met and that they have been properly entered into the banking system.

  • Continues to building proficiency of BSA techniques and AML principles by attending internal training external training and completion of continuing education courses.






POSITION TYPE/EXPECTED HOURS:



This is a full-time position. Office hours Monday – Friday 8:30am – 5:00pm. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.






WORK ENVIRONMENT:



The work environment characteristics described here are representative o

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:




  • A bachelor’s degree in a business-related field and/or one years’ experience or equivalent level of education and experience.

  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.

  • Well organized with the ability to manage multiple tasks and work to time sensitive deadlines.

  • Ability to work well independently and in groups.

  • Working knowledge with Microsoft Office Programs; Excel and Word.



PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:




  • CAMS Certification

  • Working knowledge of Patriot Officer Software



TRAVEL:



No travel required.



LANGUAGE SKILLS:



Must be able to speak read write and understand the primary language(s) used in the workplace; bilingual skills a plus. Ability to read analyze and interpret general business information including but not limited to company policies and procedures. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers and customers.



PHYSICAL DEMANDS:



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




  • This is largely sedentary role requiring use of typical office equipment such as a computer laptop and phone.

  • Ability to communicate both in person and/or by telephone.




CLICK HERE TO APPLY

title: Carefree Water Company
description:
Carefree Water Company, the municipal water utility for Carefree, AZ, is looking for an Accounting Tech/Analyst to assist in our busy office. Work will be permanent full-time position, Monday-Friday, 7am to 4pm with a 6 month probationary period. Starting pay rate will be commensurate with experience. Expected pay range is between $18 and $25 per hour depending upon experience. 

 

The candidate should be capable of handling any of the following: daily accounts receivables (A/R), accounts payable (A/P), customer service functions, and basic human resources tasks. A fundamental understanding of accounting processes and controls is essential. Advanced accounting knowledge and accounting training is a plus. Assisting in general ledger entries, sales tax payments, budget development, and audit reviews may be assigned as applicable.

 

Excellent front office customer service skills are critical to this position. Customer service duties include in-person, over the telephone, and via the internet. Other typical office duties will include filing, data entry, using a variety of common software programs (Word®, Excel®, PowerPoint®, etc.), and creating and maintaining paper and electronic documents.

 

To apply, please visit our website at www.carefreewaterco.com for an application form.  Send your completed 1) application and 2) resume to apply@carefreewaterco.com Both application and resume must be submitted in order to qualify for review. Please, no phone calls regarding this position. Check our website for position status.

title: Matrix Medical Network
description:
Technical Business Analyst

 

 

This position is analyzing business data, writing and scripting SQL. It is not a Report or Dashboard Developer.  For this position we are seeking a dynamic Analyst with strong analyst, Visio, Waterfall or Agile methodologies, data warehouse, HIPAA, HITECH, HiTrust and SQL experience.

We are driving Healthcare forward. Come join us!

 

Not your typical workday…..

 

Matrix Medical Network IT delivers capabilities using cutting edge technologies, including Mobile Tablet, Geo-spatial Analysis, Database Solutions using SQL and noSQL, Business Intelligence and Custom Business solutions. Looking for enthusiastic, action oriented team members who will thrive in our fast paced and dynamic environment.

 

The Business Data Analyst is responsible for working with internal and external clients to define data requirements and to support reporting and advance analytics from new and existing systems.

This role plays a critical role in developing key metrics, uncovering vital insights and delivering critical analysis that will lead to data-informed decisions and guide business strategy. Your expertise will influence decisions made at the highest levels of the company. 

 

  • Ensuring data implementations and integrations between application systems, data marts, and data warehouses, matches reporting and analytics requirements and will participate in high-level discussions regarding scope and alternative designs.
  •  You will work closely with senior leadership, department heads and teammates to use data to drive the success of the organization.
  • Able to communicate complex analysis and insights to various stakeholders inside and outside of analytical teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Participates in all phases of SDLC: from system analysis and design thru development and test to deployment and support.
  • Work with business stakeholders, and end users to identify and document data requirements for reports, data marts, and the data warehouse.
  • Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process analysis, use cases or user stories, scenarios, and workflow analysis
  • Provides requirements gathering estimates and participates in project planning.
  • Work closely with Report Analysts, IT Development, and Informatics leadership to review and approve design and test case documentation to ensure compliance with requirements and business goals
  • Lead, Create, Perform UAT efforts
  • Review and approve data implementation and integration test plans
  • Create Report mockups
  • Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely
  • Manage changes to baselined requirements through effective and appropriate application of change control processes and tools
  • Manage the creation and use of requirements trace information
  • Independently analyze data structures and architecture, along with business processes, to gain existing process understanding and lead requirement gathering sessions
  • Leads complex working sessions with key stakeholders for large/multi-functional projects
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and actively promote business change
  • Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents
  • Create or update user documentation that supports system functionality
  • Is able to troubleshoot any complex data related issues as well as provide support to production.
  • Ensures adherence to standards for self as well as team.
  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements: 

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a relevant discipline
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst (Work in a related area can be taken into consideration)
  • 5+ years of experience with all Microsoft Office Tools (must include Excel and Visio)
  • 2+ years of experience with SQL Server
  • Knowledgeable in relational, non-relational, document model, and data warehouse data structures a must
  • Proficient understanding and ability to operate inside an Agile or Waterfall Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Leadership skills, to create a collaborative environment and influence people to move toward a common goal
  • Interviewing and questioning skills, to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information
  • Communication skills, to communicate information effectively and in the appropriate form to customers, businesss users and technical staff
  • Interpersonal skills, to build strong working relationships with other team members and customers
  • Organizational skills, to monitor and track multiple projects and the associated tasks simultaneously and cope with rapidly changing information and circumstances
  • Ability to work in a self-directed environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated experience of estimation and planning
  • Ability to be flexible, set priorities and meet deadlines in a changing environment for self as well as team.
  • Must have decision-making skills for problem identification and solution recommendation.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team while demonstrating initiative and using good business judgment
  • Demonstrated ability to drive process improvement and improve the process efficiency
  • Demonstrated ability to reduce and/or prevent production defects based on the continuous root cause analysis and process improvement
  • Ability to maintain effective working relationships across teams and with a diverse workforce
  • Able to represent the Company in a positive and professional manner.
  • Preferred Skills and Abilities:
  • Healthcare experience preferred, specifically Medicare Advantage, Care Management, and/or Pharmacy
  • Experience with knowledge of industry regulations: HIPAA, HITECH, HiTrust, etc. 

Supervisory Responsibilities: none  

Travel Requirements: ability to travel up to 15%

 

Matrix Medical Network is Proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Boehringer Ingelheim Animal Health USA Inc.
description: Sr. Technical Analyst w/ Boehringer Ingelheim Animal Health USA Inc., Duluth, GA. Design, dvlp, & maintain of BI rel software & systems (Alteryx, Tableau, Qlik, Cognos11, SSMS, and SSAS), incl integrations w/ databases and ERP systems, as well as help to define the overall data architecture (e.g., ETL process, ODS, EDW, Data Marts). Position reqs a Master’s deg (US or foreign equiv) in Stats, Math, Mkt Research, or a rel quantitative discipline AND 10 yrs of exp in the job offered or in a rel role. Prior exp must incl: Exp analyzing & manipulating unstructured data using Alteryx, Tableau, R, SAS Visual Analytics; Exp w/ Exasol, Alteryx, IBM Cognos Analytics, IBM Cognos TM1, QlikView, Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, SSAS, SSMS, SQL & DW/ODL environments; Exp using complex SQL queries to extract data from databases, & conduct basic stat analyses using tools such as SPSS, Stata, SAS, & Excel; Exp w/ leading ETL tools, such as SAP Data Services, MS SSIS, Informatica; Exp w/ stat modeling methodologies & tools (R, Python, SAS, & SPSS); Exp extracting & manipulating data from multiple data sources (i.e. delimited text files, Excel, RDBMS, Access) & integrating them into a single source view/report/dataset; Exp w/ database technologies & SQL language for querying & manipulating datasets. Exp w/ data warehousing concepts incl data integration & data warehouse objects; Exp using prog languages such as Python, SQL, & Java; Exp w/ the major big data solutions like Hadoop, Map Reduce, Hive, Pig & other tools in the Hadoop ecosystem; Exp working w/ Predictive Analytics tools incl IBM Watson Analytics, IBM SPSS Modeler, & R; Exp w/ PL/SQL Scripting & working on Oracle Stored Procedures & Functions; Exp w/ leading OLAP/ROLAP tools (Business Objects, MS, Microstrategy Hyperion Essbase or Cognos); Exp w/ modern visualization frameworks, such as Gephi, Processing, R &/or D3.js; Exp w/ NoSQL platforms; & exp w/ dimensional modeling techniques & creation of logical & physical data models (entity relationship modeling, Erwin diagrams). Qualified Applicants: To apply visit www.boehringer-ingelheim.us/careers. Click on careers & apply (under jobs), enter #205288 into the keywords field. Click on the Sr. Technical Analyst, scroll to the bottom of the page & click on apply online to submit your application.

title: LRS
description:
Looking for more than just another assignment? We're looking for you! This isn't just another assignment, but a real opportunity and a challenge for the right person. LRS Consulting Services is seeking a QA Analyst for a 6-month contract to hire opportunity with our client in Wellesley, MA or Reston, VA! 

LRS Consulting Services has been delivering the highest quality consultants to our clients since 1979. We've built a solid reputation for dealing with our clients and our consultants with honesty, integrity, and respect. We work hard every day to maintain that reputation, and we're very interested in candidates who can help us. If you're that candidate, this opportunity is made for you!

 

The QA Analyst will:

  • Be responsible for leading QA efforts related to customer implementations of software platforms.

  • Work closely with project managers, product managers, business analysts, application consultants, UX designers, and software developers within an agile software development framework to plan and execute integration testing and UAT.

  • Review product requirements, functional specs, and design specifications to create comprehensive test cases.

  • Provide accurate estimates and status updates on QA deliverables such as test plans and test execution.

  • Define exit/entry criteria for project testing gates (unit, integration, acceptance).

  • Participate in the creation and upkeep of automated tests.

  • Lead QA efforts related to new customer implementations and work closely with Project Managers to validate our hosted products.

  • Provide regular updates on the status of implementations, open issues and potential risks.

  • Submit bugs that are easy to reproduce and understand and verify fixes in a timely manner.

  • Perform functional, system, regression and performance tests as needed.

  • Effectively communicate with remote and local team members.

  • Communicate project risks as soon as possible and offer viable mitigation strategies.

  • Partner with project managers, developers, and analysts within the program team and across the Product Development team to manage and continually improve the test practice.

  • Work with the support organization to quickly resolve customer issues.

  • Define and govern test environment management.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years’ experience in a similar QA role

  • 5+ year’s prior experience in Quality Assurance working with web-based and enterprise application software

  • Experience with Agile methodology and working within Agile methodology and working within Agile development teams  

  • Experience creating and maintaining functional, regression, integration and user acceptance test suites

  • Experience developing and maintaining automated and performance test scripts

  • Strong experience documenting, designing and developing test plans and test strategies

  • Previous experience working with automated testing tools

  • Experience implementing test documentation and issue tracking standards within IT organizations

  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines

  • Strong candidates will have experience in the Energy industry

  • Candidate must be able to effectively communicate in English (written & verbal)

LRS is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment will receive consideration without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, gender identity, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, citizenship status or protected veteran status.

title: Latham Pool Products, Inc.
description:
Primary Role:The Business Analyst’s primary purpose is to analyze, evaluate and refine business processes.The BA develops technical solutions to business problems and is responsible for maintenance on multiple systems (ERP, QM, Production, etc).In addition, the BA engages in projects across the organization and leads requirements management, implementation and delivery of new systems and /or software solutions.

•3+ years’ experience in business analysis, gathering requirements, and configuring/customizing systems 

•Preferred project management certification 

•Experience successfully leading the design and implementation of at least one full project cycle 

•Manufacturing ERP experience preferred 

•Highly developed skills: problem-solving, tenacity, drive, creativity, planning and organization 

•Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment with a variety of systems 

•Excellent presentation, written, verbal and communication skills with the ability to engage and influence employees and leaders at all levels of the organization 

•Bachelor’s degree in related field required or an equivalent combination of education and experience

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking; possesses ability to review, analyze, compare, and interpret data to draw conclusions and make recommendations.
  • Proficiency in MS Office Applications to create/develop reporting databases and conduct in depth data analysis/modeling.
  • General knowledge of relational databases preferred.

Primary responsibilities:

  • Support the modeling of financial and organizational impacts of the enterprise transformation programs, assisting in the translation of business strategies into effective programs.
  • Partnering with HR transformation team support the talent resourcing and mapping to roles, reporting and analytics for town mobilization.
  • Providing project support, including participating in meetings, managing source documents, and responding to customer inquiries.
  • Providing adhoc analysis of data for our enterprise transformation program to identify trends and insights.
  • Performing data quality assurance checks, manipulate and analyze large amounts of data, and prepare client-ready spreadsheets.

title: Odyssey Systems
description:
Title:  Contract Writing System Trainer/Analyst, Senior

Job Location: Wright Patterson AFB, OH

Odyssey Systems has an exciting new opportunity for a Contract Writing System Trainer/Analyst supporting the AFLCMC/PK. 

Odyssey Systems Consulting Group, Ltd. is an innovative small business committed to providing world-class technical, management, and training support services to government and public sector clients. We focus on people, processes, and performance to deliver superior results. Since our inception in 1997, our commitment to mission success and customer satisfaction has been recognized with exponential growth and exceptional past performance ratings. We accept challenging assignments and drive projects from the planning stages, through implementation, and into operations and support.

Job Responsibilities:

Duties include, but not limited to:

  • Software Development Support - Assist with beta testing new Contract Writing Systems (CWS) versions as required; travel within the continental U.S. (CONUS) for USAF trainings specific to CON-IT, and support the development of an initial roll-out CON-IT training plan for the most effective rapid deployment through AFLCMC/PK at WPAFB.
  • Training Support - Conduct hands-on training classes for CWSs including teaching required courses IAW the PWS; developing and presenting training plans; and provide training in a CWS administrator context.
  • Develop electronic training materials with Government-supported software packages including but not limited to Blackboard and PDF/MS PowerPoint training modules;
  • Provide feedback and planning oversight for training support purposes;
  • Present Introduction to the CWS courses (ConWrite and/or CON) on an ongoing basis;
  • Develop/craft courses to address system tool refinements, as well as to mitigate user-error trends identified by the CWS Help Desk.
  • Deliver training materials in a webinar setting; provide training in a buyer/PCO context; and update and adjust trainings as required, for new CWS versions/changes.
  • Incorporate contracting knowledge raining classes developed and presented in such a way that the training is presented in an appropriate context using realistic and commonly encountered contracting scenarios. At a minimum, knowledge of and experience with the following items must be demonstrated in the training:
    • Federal, departmental, agency laws, Executive Orders, regulations, and procedures applicable to the acquisition process and to the administration of contracts;
    • Various contract types, to include, but not be limited to, firm-fixed-price, fixed-price incentive, firm fixed price with award fee/award term, cost plus fixed fee, cost plus incentive fee, and cost-plus award fee/award term;
    • Processes for negotiated procurements, to include, but not be limited to, source selection procedures, sole-source contracts, sole-source 8(a) contracts, and competitive 8(a) contracts;
    • Contract administration principles and the practices to monitor Contractor performance and resolve issues;
    • Contract close-out procedures, and;
    • Basic contracting skills and abilities, including an understanding of the terminology associated with the contract administration process.
  • Present the following courses on an ongoing/as-needed basis:
    • Buy Plans
    • Federal Procurement Data System – Next Generation (FPDS-NG) Contract Action Report (CAR)
    • Contract Clauses
    • Contract Line Item Numbers (CLINs) and Accounting Classification Reference Numbers (ACRNs)
    • Other Agency Delivery Orders
    • Contract Modifications
    • Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and Other Solicitation Instruments
    • Undefinitized Contract Actions (UCAs)
    • Administrative Contracting Officer (ACO) Modifications
    • Contract Closeout
  • Help Desk Support - Support the AFLCMC/PZCY help desk as required, including but not limited to:
    • CWS help desk support
    • Troubleshooting common user problems;
    • Researching out-of-balance contracts; Auditing various contract records;
    • Reporting findings to AFLCMC/PZCY team members and/or outside users;
    • Analyze help desk ticket submissions to identify user-error trends and PZCY continuous improvement opportunities;
    • Provide support on any other identified tasks.
  • Administrative Support - Be responsible for: scheduling training classes for Wright-Patterson AFB personnel and support contractors; maintaining records of training class attendance; and maintaining files and forms within established file plans.
  • Responsible for ensuring that the Government training facility is clean and presentable, and for ensuring that the facility remains accessible to anyone who is hearing or sight-impaired, or who has any other identified physical disability.
    • Report any facility-related or equipment-related issues to AFLCMC/PZCY.

 Minimum Qualifications:

  • Be familiar with the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR).
  • Gain and maintain proficiency with CON-IT as the system is developed and deployed, in tandem with AFLCMC/PZCY’s expertise.
  • Be familiar with ConWrite.
  • At least 24 hours of college-level business courses
  • 10 years of government contracting experience with progressively increasing responsibility
  • Mastery of the knowledge of USAF, AFMC, AFLCMC, DoD, and private-sector contracting principles, laws, statutes, Executive Orders, regulations and procedures sufficient to develop and provide guidance and training to Wright-Patterson AFB contracting and CWS administrator personnel
  • Highly skilled in both verbal and written communication, in order to develop and present highly complex procurement training material accessed through CWSs in a manner that produces well-trained buyers/procurement contracting officers (PCOs), contractor support personnel, and CWS administrators.

 Preferred Qualifications:

  • Capable of working in one-on-one, small group, and large group settings to facilitate and support the contract requirements.

 Additional Information:

  • Favorable National Agency Check with Written Inquires (NACI) required

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.  Odyssey Systems Consulting Group, LTD. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or other factors protected by federal, state, and/or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment
#LI-POST

title: FactSet Research Systems
description:
Role/Department Description:

The Senior Marketing Analyst role at FactSet will drive the data input, management, and analysis for lead/demand generation activities across the organization.  The Analyst will work closely with Product Marketers, US Sales, and New Business teams to increase and analyze the quantity and quality of leads, helping drive overall Annual Subscription Value. This role reports directly into FactSet’s Marketing department which is responsible for all global branding, prospecting, and market-facing communications.

Responsibilities:

  • Gather and analyze data across all marketing channels and work with fellow team members on recommendations for optimizing activity in order to increase the impact of marketing across the organization.  
  • Work closely with the Marketing leadership team to implement standard metrics and measurement processes that result in KPIs to measure success
  • Research and evaluate tools that allow creation of reports and dashboards that combine data across all marketing channels including, digital, social, and email marketing to better understand how activities are connected and performing.   
  • Analyze and interpret trends by channels, content types, and personas and share actionable insights with senior marketing leadership and channel owners to maximize campaign performance
  • Synthesize data to make it easily digestible and create a narrative that explain the “story” behind the numbers along with actionable recommendations.
  • Work with senior marketing management to help them understand the numbers behind the marketing strategies by connecting marketing activity effectiveness to the business’s bottom line.
  • Detect root causes of changes in metrics and effectively communicate these insights to stakeholders and marketing leadership.
  • Be the team expert on pulling information across platforms
  • Work with the Operations team to ensure accuracy of data and consistency across all systems.

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor's degree required with a concentration in marketing, statistics or similar
  • 7+ years of experience analyzing and reporting on lead generation sources and metrics
  • Business-to-business experience
  • Ability to perform quantitative and qualitative market analysis to identify key market statistics and interpret findings to create insights from that data. Mastery of Microsoft Excel.
  • Excellent presentation skills. Comfortable using data to bring up new opportunities and best practices to your teammates to improve the way we operate and grow.
  • Ability and experience analyzing and interpreting marketing data to draw conclusions.
  • Ability to understand business needs and marketing operations in a marketing organization.
  • Highly organized, detail-orientated, and self-motivated
  • Highly proficient with HubSpot and Salesforce and/or other marketing automation and CRM software, and Google Webmaster tools
  • Knowledge of Sprout Social, Kapost, and Google Adwords a plus

FactSet is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Slocum and Sons
description:
Company:                  Slocum & Sons

Job Title:                   Project Manager - Business Intelligence Analyst

Department:              IT Department

Reports to:                 Director of MIS

Prepared Date:          6/2/20

Revised Date:            6/10/20

 

SUMMARY

The primary focus of this role is to manage department projects.  This role will oversee new projects as well as routine upkeep after completion.  Additional focus will be supporting and creating reports for the sales and management teams including Business Intelligence tools.

 

ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE

  • Intimate knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics/Great Plains
    • Infuzion beverage Industry specific front end to Great Plains
    • Wine and Spirits Industry Specific Knowledge
    • Microsoft Office primarily Excel
  • Project Management
    • Work with department heads and ancillary offices to organize, manage and implement new projects
  • System Knowledge
    • Windows 10
    • SQL Server Database
    • Microsoft Office and SharePoint
    • PowerBI
    • Crystal Reports
  • IOS Knowledge

 

QUALIFICATIONS

This position requires a professional with advanced Project Management skills as well as software and database knowledge necessary to revolutionize the way our company increase efficiency and functionality. Critical and analytical thinking and statistical computer software skills are a must and will be relied upon to understand the company needs and implement the selected solutions.  Candidate must be a highly motivated, positive, organized self-starter who can work well with a variety of tasks and adapt quickly to different business needs, projects, and deadlines.  This individual will interact with all levels of sales and management staff.

 

 

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

  • College degree in a quantitative field or equivalence business experience desired
  • 3-4 years Project Management and Database/reporting experience
  • ERP and Report Design software knowledge (ideally Microsoft Dynamics/Great Plains)   
  • Advanced computer software skills including Business Intelligence software (PowerBI and Crystal Reports)
  • Excel power user with strong editing and data manipulation skills
  • Proficiency with MS Office Suite as well as SharePoint
  • Progressive experience in data extraction, structured in a useable simplified format
  • Solid knowledge of database structure and management, with ability to manipulate and analyze data across large and disperse databases (SQL).
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, and a track record of presenting data-heavy information in a clear and concise manner to all levels of sales and management
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize workload, and balance multiple projects and deadlines
  • Work in conjunction with IT department
  • Working knowledge of beverage industry, a plus

title: Fidelity TalentSource
description:
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Business Analyst to work at Fidelity in Boston, MA.

Description

As part of the Product Management team, the Business Analyst is responsible for contributing to the delivery of quality products to customers by understanding product strategy, industry trends and customer needs, developing business cases, defining business requirements, and supporting product development and deployment. This role will serve as a key advisor for the requirements process on complex projects within Fidelity Corporate Actions Solutions.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Participate in multiple phases of the development lifecycle, from the initial analysis and business requirements definition through business acceptance testing and production implementation
  • Serve as business lead on multiple projects of low to medium size and complexity, or a single project of high visibility, complexity or risk
  • Understand sophisticated business issues, define creative solutions and document detailed business requirements
  • Provide leadership through the understanding of the project life cycle and business needs; work closely with the project team to determine project tasks, estimates, deadlines, deliverables and interdependencies
  • Partner with the Technology team to ensure a common understanding of requirements and acceptance criteria
  • Ensure organizational readiness for new improvements and provide training where appropriate
  • Determine business acceptance test strategy, prepare and execute test cases as needed
  • Build business cases to find opportunities for new corporate action products, features or services based on customer needs and market conditions
  • Partner with Sales and Relationship Management during consultative sessions with prospects and clients; provide subject matter expertise, product demonstrations and responses to RFI questions

Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of experience in financial services
  • Full corporate action lifecycle, including accounting system processing, and business analysis experience is required
  • Experience with software development methodologies (Agile and Waterfall)

Skills and Knowledge

  • Proven track record to analyze business systems and processes to identify user needs, document requirements, and address operational/process issues to accomplish business objectives
  • Demonstrated experience in translating business requirements to technical resources (internal and external)
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail, ability to work independently
  • Strong communication, presentation and active listening skills are essential to success
  • Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate organizational skills and clarity of thought
  • Strong leadership skills, ability to influence and champion ideas effectively across multiple and diverse groups

 


Company Overview

Fidelity TalentSource, formerly Veritude, is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We recruit individuals from a variety of backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s diverse and inclusive workplace while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. For information about working at Fidelity TalentSource, visit FTSJobs.com.

Information about Fidelity Investments

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.

Fidelity Investments and Fidelity TalentSource are equal opportunity employers.

title: HersheyCareers
description:
Job Title: Senior Analyst, Commercial Planning Solutions


Job Location: Hershey, PA


 


 


Major Duties/Responsibilities: 


 



  • Support enterprise wide SAP Direct Marketing Expense (DME) and DME Advanced Analytics (DMEAA) Solutions.  This includes providing functional and technical guidance on SAP CRM/BW and BI reporting built in PowerBI/Alteryx with a fair amount of functional understanding of Direct Marketing Expense solution.

  • Manage support incidents and enhancement requests identifying areas of improvements in process and technology, driving continuous improvement and staying abreast of industry and technology trends.   

  • Liaise with Business partners in sales finance and controller teams to build capabilities on DME and Analytics. This includes jointly defining business objectives and goals, developing business cases, evaluating current technologies, communicating new technology capabilities, without losing focus on supporting the current system.

  • Contribute in maximizing system accuracy, uptime and performance for the DME and Advanced Analytics solutions:

    • Through expert lens of navigating SAP BW and CRM code for DME, provide technical recommendations on code changes for marketing and campaigns ensuring minimal impact on business processes, and systems.

    • Through data analyst lens and report building experience, support advanced analytics needs of marketing and campaigning teams.

    • Coordinate with IS and business teams to prioritize and implement changes and strategies.

    • Work collaboratively with business strategists, process owners and subject matter experts.

    • Coordinate with architecture and technical teams to manage application lifecycle.

    • Anticipate the resource needs ahead and galvanize resources to achieve desired results. Find and optimize resources to get the job done.

    • Manage the offshore managed services resources to ensure no disruption to critical business functions



 


Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:  


Education:



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Services (MIS), Engineering or related field

  • Master’s degree a plus 


Experience:



  • 5 Years of technology implementation experience, preferably within a large company or consulting organization

  • 5 years of experience with SAP products with emphasis on SAP CRM / TPM / DME, SAP SD, SAP BW and SAP FI

  • Demonstrate considerable knowledge of and success in applying extensive understanding of the SAP DME and BW planning solutions

  • Proficiency with technology and software including Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)

  • Ability to quickly learn to use new and evolving products, tools and technologies to support the business.

  • Experience working in application development and delivery functions applying standard software development methodologies and managing medium sized programs.

  • Strong interpersonal, influencing, negotiation, organization and communication skills.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Data analysis experience with IRI / Nielsen datasets is a plus.

  • SAP certification is a plus.

  • CPG experience is a plus.
